 Preface  
 
This book collects the edited Abstracts of the 5th International Symposium on 
Environmental Biotechnology and Engineering (5ISEBE) held in July 25th-29th, 2016, in 
the National University of San Martín, San Martín, Buenos Aires, Arge ntina.  
This book aims at reaching a wide audience including researchers, practitioners, 
managers, and students who aspire to learn about or to create a deeper scientific 
foundation as well as technological applications of Environmental Engineering and 
Environmental Biotechnology that address creative and feasible solutions to 
environmental pollution and sustainable development.  
The 5ISEBE  accepted a total of 283 abstracts (Table 1) after a strict peer -reviewing 
process. These contributions were distributed among 18 subjects, from emerging and 
promising topics such as Renewable and alternative energies and biorefineries , and 
Green materials and biomaterials  to more traditional, although very important 
subjects, such as Groundwater and aquifer remediation  and Wastewater treatment . 
It is worth highlighting the high number of contributions classified under four emerging 
and increasingly important topics: Renewable and alternative energies and 
biorefineries , Sustainability and environmental system analysis , Enviro nmental 
nanotechnology , and Green materials and biomaterials  that accounted for one third 
(33%) of the total abstracts and were close to the most classic and mature subjects 
constituted by Wastewater treatment  and the two topics on  Remediation (nearly 35% , 
Table 1).  
Abstracts came from seventeen countries (Table 2) thus confirming the international 
repercussion of the 5ISEBE. There was a large contribution from countries in Latin 
America such as Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, and Mexico. European countries b oth from 
Western and Eastern Europe also submitted works to the Symposium.  Interestingly, 
there is a noticeable presence of African countries represented by scientists from 
Algeria, Tunisia, and South Africa.   
This striking feature of the abstract distri bution is consistent with the locomotive effect 
of the increasing interest on renewable energies and new materials that has permeated 
environmental applications in recent years. Moreover, it is an indication of the high 
degree of innovation that characteri zes Environmental Biotechnology and Environmental 
Engineering R&D in the 21st century.  
The synergistic interaction of Environmental Biotechnology and Environmental 
Engineering has a tremendous potential for making outstanding contributions to the 
sustainab le development and sustainable management of resources in modern 
societies. To a great extent, we expect that these contributions will also positively impact 
on societies’ organization and improve people’s consciousness, education and habits. 
Sustainable d evelopment should become the basis for the life of future generations as 
opposed to over -exploitation of non -renewable energy and material resources.  
On the one hand, there were several international and regional events dealing with 
Biotechnology but no ot her international event was devoted entirely to Environmental 
Biotechnology. At most, Environmental Biotechnology is the subject of  one or two 
sessions in a Biotechnology Congress.

 On the other hand, most regional Environmental Engineering events showed a strong 
commercial component that negatively competed with the exchange of advanced 
knowledg e and the formation of research networks.  
Moreover, Environmental Biotechnology and Environmental Engineering are two 
dynamic drives with a strong interaction, and the scientific community could obtain 
several advantages from their joint diffusion. In shor t, there was a need for an 
international event dedicated to both disciplines, with a strong vocation for serious 
dissemination of scientific and technological knowledge, as well as research networking.  
The synthesis to this diagnostic was to launch a new event focused on both 
disciplines. In this way, the First International Meeting on Environmental Biotechnology 
and Engineering was born and held in Mexico City in 2004. This first event was co -
organized by the Dept. of Biotechnology and Bioengineering at C INVESTAV of the IPN 
in Mexico, the IRD from France, the IMIA from Spain, the Mexican Polytechnic Institute 
(IPN) from Mexico, the National University of Mexico (UNAM, México), the University of 
Hidalgo (UAEH, México), among others. The event was backed -up by a diverse 
International Scientific Committee that had the contributions of outstanding scientists 
and professionals from Brazil, Italy, Spain, Scotland, France, and Mexico.  
In 2008, we had the satisfaction to see that the 3rd International Meeting on 
Environmental Biotechnologya and Engineering held in Palma de Mallorca, Spain, had 
exponentially grown and matured. Its outreach was multiplied by a factor of 10 
compared to that of the 1st  IMEBE . The Organizing Committee led by Dr. Isabel Sastre -
Conde has to be congratulated for the success and resonance of the third version of this 
event. This was a confirmation of the original diagnostic: the scientific community was 
avid of an international event with the characteristics of the IMEBE . At the same time, 
the success of the 3IMEBE  in Palma de Mallorca led to a change of name and format, 
from Meeting to Symposium, in order to reflect the increases on both quantity and 
quality of our event.  
Following its international vocation, now the 5ISEBE  is held in Argent ina, South 
America, led by a dynamic and committed group of outstanding Argentinian 
academicians headed by Dr. Gustavo Curutchet and Dr. Roberto Candal, accompanied 
by Dr. Susana Vázquez, as well as a group of international experts rooted in the IMEBE -
ISEB E history, such as Dr. Isabel Sastre -Conde from Spain, Dr. Hervé Macarie from 
France, among others. With them, the ISEBE’ s dream goes on.  
Regarding publications, the 5ISEBE  is also preparing the book “ Environmental 
Biotechnology and Engineering -2016 ” whos e chapters will be based on selected full 
articles presented in the Symposium.  
Therefore, this  book intitle “ ISEBE  Abstracts  2016”  along with the book 
“Environmental Biotechnology and Engineering -2016 ” offer a body of the current cutting -
edge approaches an d knowledge in crucial areas of environmental care, new energ ies, 
and sustainble development.  
We look forward to meeting you at the 6th. International Symposium on 
Environmental Biotechnology and Engineering ( 6ISEBE ) in 2018.

 Biodegradation of hydrolyzed tannins: a biotechnology for recovery of 
potent antioxidants  
 
Cristobal N. Aguilar(1)*, Raul Rodriguez -Herrera(1), Antonio Aguilera -Carbó(2), Alberto Ascacio -Valdes(1), 
Arely Prado -Barragán(3), Leonardo Sepúlveda -Torre(1), Juan Buenrostro -Figueroa(3), Jose L Martinez(1), 
Juan Carlos Contreras -Esquivel(1). 
 
(1) Universidad Autónoma de Coahuila, School of Chemistry, Salt illo, Coahuila, México.  
(2) Universidad Autónoma Agraria Antonio Narro, Buenavista, Saltillo, Coahuila, México  
(3) Universidad Autónoma Metropolitana, Iztapalapa, Ciudad de México.  
 
Tannins are water -soluble polyphenolic compounds having wide prevalence in plant s. 
Hydrolysable and condensed tannins are the two major classes of tannins. These 
compounds have a range of effects on various organisms --from toxic effects on animals 
to growth inhibition of microorganisms. Some microbes are, however, resistant to 
tannins , and have developed various mechanisms and pathways for tannin degradation 
in their natural milieu. The microbial degradation of tannins is, however, poorly 
understood in both aerobic and anaerobic environments. A number of microbes have 
also been isolate d from soils and tannin rich wastes, which have the ability to break 
tannin -protein complexes and degrade tannins, especially hydrolysable tannins. In this 
contribution, a comparative study of the biochemical pathways for biodegradation of both 
types of ta nnins are presented and discussed. Aspergillus niger  GH1 was evaluated in 
Solid -State Fermentation using tannins as sole carbon source and column bioreactors 
were packed with polyurethane foam impregnated of culture medium. Pomegranate 
tannins and tannic a cid were used as substrates. Bioprocesses were kinetically 
monitored and the interest molecules were analyzed by HPLC -MS to elucidated the 
biochemical pathway of biodegradation. Also, from extracts the enzymatic activities were 
assayed. Enzymes involved in  the biodegradation processes are defined and also, the 
intermediate and final compounds released were identified and valorized as potent 
antioxidants.  
 
 
Keywords : Biodegradation, gallotannins, ellagitannins, antioxidants.

Waste cactus ( Opuntia spp.) are a rich source of biomass by produce biogas and bio -
fertilizers on a commercial scale. The main advantages of this plant compared to other 
crops are high biom ass yield per hectare of crop, widely adapted, rapid growth and low 
inputs requirements. The aim of this study was to evaluate the effect of adjusting C:N 
ratio-combined with alkaline pretreatment waste Opuntia heliabravoana Sheinvar, in the 
production of biogas and bio -fertilizer in anaerobic reactors. Four reactors with a volume 
of 1.54L operation (adjustable in the C:N ratio -with alkaline pre -treatment, CNAPR and 
control, CR) were used for 85 days with a semi continuous with organic loading rate 2.31 
Kg/m3∙d and HRT of 36 days. To evaluate the effects of treatment RCNAP in biofertilizer 
quality (pH, EC, COD, TSS, VSS, N, P, K, Ca, Mn, Mg, Zn, Fe, Cu, fecal coliforms, 
gibberellins and humic acids) and biogas production and their composition. RCNAP 
reactors s howed greater efficiency in the removal of organic matter and biogas 
production compared to the RC. Similarly, biofertilizer with alkaline pretreatment 
obtained showed an increase of 3: 1 in nitrogen concentration and fewer pathogenic 
microorganisms compar ed to CR. Although the alkali treatment improved efficiency in 
the production of biogas and bio -fertilizer nitrogen, it is important to assess whether it is 
economically feasible to deploy full scale.  
 
Keywords : cactus, methane, carbon/nitrogen ratio, alka line pre -treatment, biodigester.

 Aislamiento de bacterias fermentadoras de xilosa y arabinosa como 
potenciales productoras de hidrogeno  
 
I.M. Campos *(1), S.F. Aquino(1), S.Q. Silva(1) 
(1) Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto, campus morro de cruzeiro, Ouro Preto, Brasil.  
 
La biomasa lignoc elulósica es una atractiva fuente de carbono para la producción de 
biocombustibles y otros productos. En general la biomasa lignocelulósica esta 
compuesta por 40 -50% de celulosa, 25 -30% de hemicelulosa, 15 -20% de lignina y otros 
componentes extraíbles. Deb ido a la complejidad del material lignocelulósico  es 
necesario realizar una hidrólisis de sus componentes para que los azucares queden 
libres y puedan ser utilizados por los microorganismos en la fermentación. El objetivo 
principal de este trabajo fue hal lar cepas bacterianas que toleren las condiciones del 
hidrolizado lignocelulósico y sean capaces de producir hidrogeno a partir de azucares 
de cinco carbonos.  
Las cepas bacterianas fueron aisladas a partir de una muestra de un reactor 
anaeróbico conteniend o bagazo de caña tratado por autohidrólisis. Con la muestra del 
reactor se realizo una dilución seriada que fue inoculada en diferentes medios de 
cultivo. Posteriormente los aislados bacterianos fueron identificados molecularmente, el 
gen que codifica para  rDNA 16S fue amplificado  y las secuencias obtenidas fueron 
comparadas con secuencias de cepas homologas en la base de datos Ribosomal 
Database Project: data and tools for high throughput rRNA analysis. Como resultado 
fueron aisladas varias cepas bacterian as a partir de un reactor anaeróbico, la mayoría 
de los aislados bacterianos pertenecen a la familia Enterobacteriaceae y son capaces 
de crecer en xilosa y/o arabinosa. Interesantemente la cepa bacteriana 4 perteneciente 
al genero Enterobacter creció bien en ambos azucares, esta capacidad y sus 
propiedades fermentativas hacen de esta cepa un anaerobio facultativo prometedor 
para la producción de hidrógeno a partir de los azúcares provenientes de la hidrólisis de 
la hemicelulosa .  
 
 
Palabras clave : Arabinosa , xilosa, biohidrogeno, fermentación.

 Assessment of marine and run of river energy potential and the 
requirements for engineering higher education and research 
institutions to support the industry in Colombia  
 
Ramón Fernando Colmenares -Quintero*(1), Gareth Davies(2), Natalia Arure Alvarez -Rojas (3) , Sandy 
Kerr (4) , Colin Bullen (5)       
(1) Research Group TERMOMEC/Universidad Cooperativa de Colombia, Calle 50A No. 41 -34, Medellín, 
Colombia  
(2) Aquatera Limited, Old A cademy Business Centre, Stromness, Orkney, KW15 3AW, Scotland  
(3) Aquatera Limited, Old Academy Business Centre, Stromness, Orkney, KW15 3AW, Scotland  
(4) International Centre for Island Technology (ICIT)/Heriot -Watt University, Old Academy, Back Road, 
Stromness, Orkney, KW16 3AW, Scotland  
(5) International Centre for Island Technology (ICIT)/Heriot -Watt University, Old Academy, Back Road, 
Stromness, Orkney, KW16 3AW, Scotland  
 
This study will draw on the United Kingdom (UK)’s world -leading expertise in marine 
(wave, t idal, ocean thermal) and run of river energy to deliver enhanced knowledge 
exchange between Colombian and UK businesses and academia, and to develop a 
capacity building programmed for engineering teaching and research in support of this 
emerging industry. The Government of Colombia acknowledges the potential role for 
marine and run of river energy to supply clean energy to coastal communities 
nationwide: marine energy is mentioned in the Colombian Law 1715 which states that 
the Government will develop suppo rt instruments to measure the country’s marine 
energy resources. Colombia has a large marine energy potential: Aquatera Ltd. has 
identified at least 26 locations in the Colombian Caribbean and 2 locations on the 
Colombian Pacific with exploitable marine en ergy resources  
On the other hand, the economic and regional development benefits of marine energy 
deployments are also increasingly widely recognized, particularly where elements of the 
system can be manufactured locally or where community ownership. Given  the early 
development stage of wave and tidal power technologies, there are however challenges 
to be overcome before commercial projects can happen in Colombia. This may take 
some time, however there is a sense of urgency to consolidate Colombian research  
capacities and to ensure that the next generations of engineering graduates have the 
necessary skills to support the rapid growth of renewables.  
The marine energy industry in the UK has benefited from the availability of an 
extensive existing network of maritime infrastructure, support vessels and a skilled 
workforce that has built up around the North Sea oil and gas industry. Colombia has a 
different set of circumstances, but strengthening links with international institutions 
already active in marine en ergy will support capacity building in the country.  
This paper will show a brief review of available information on: Colombia’s marine 
energy resource and government renewable energy strategy; engineering research and 
development (R&D) and innovation acti vity, policies and educational practice; existing 
marine infrastructure and supply chain capacity and skills gaps.  
 
Keywords : Renewable; Marine and Run of River Energy; Capacity Building.

 Combustion of pistachio shell: eva luation of kinetic and 
thermodynamic parameters  
 
Jean Constantino Gomes da Silva*(1), José Luiz Francisco Alves(2), Wendell Venicio de Araujo 
Galdino(1), José Vítor Scharf(2), Humberto Jorge José(2) 
(1) Federal University of Paraiba, Cidade Universitária, João  Pessoa, Brazil  
(2) Federal University of Santa Catarina, Eng. Agronômico Andrei Cristian Ferreira St., Florianópolis, 
Brazil  
 
The present concern with sustainable development has allowed research in the field 
of renewable energy to become essential in order t o ensure a future in which the world 
primary energy is not only dependent of non -renewable sources. Among the renewable 
sources, biomass in form of waste, whether industrial, agricultural or urban, has shown 
great relevance because of its low cost and the several conversion routes.  
Therefore, the present work had the objective to characterize the pistachio shell 
waste and evaluate the thermal and kinetic behavior of the combustion process. The 
pistachio shell was characterized through the proximate analysis , scanning electron 
microscopy with energy dispersive X -ray spectroscopy (SEM/EDS) and Fourier 
transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR). The thermal and kinetic behavior were 
evaluated by a thermogravimetric analyzer under oxidant atmosphere in the temperatu re 
range of 30 ºC to 1000 ºC, where the process was performed in four different heating 
rates (10, 20, 30 e 40 ºC min-1). Through the data were calculated activation energy 
(Ea), frequency factor (A) and the model of the reaction (f( α)) by isoconversional method 
of Coats -Redfern. The thermodynamic parameters, enthalpy ( ΔH), Gibbs free energy 
(ΔG) and entropy ( ΔS) were determined by the results for Ea and A.  
Based on thermogravimetric profiles of pistachio shell combustion, the presenc e of 
two distinct zones of mass loss were observed. The first zone is associated with 
volatilization that occurs between temperatures of 200 ºC and 375 ºC, with activation 
energy and frequency factor being 128.9 kJ mol-1 and 2.68x1010 min-1, respectively. In 
this first zone, the reaction occurs through diffusional model, with thermodynamic 
parameters value of ΔH = 133.8 kJ min-1, ΔG = 179.1 kJ min-1 and ΔS = -76.8 J min-1. 
The second zone, on the other hand, occurs between temperatures of 400 ºC to 600 ºC, 
and refers to biochar oxidation, presenting E a = 119.3 kJ.min-1 and A = 5.55x107 min-1. 
The values of enth alpy, Gibbs free energy and entropy for this zone were 125.2 kJ min-1, 
199.9 kJ min-1 and -126.3 J.min-1, respectively. Furthermore, it was observed that in this 
zone the reaction occurs under the Avrami –Erofe’ev model. The results demonstrate the 
applicab ility of the residue studied in combustion process, which may be used in 
development design and optimization reactors.  
 
 
Keywords : Coats –Redfern method; combustion; pistachio shell; thermodynamic parameters.

 Improvement of endoglucanase production by Cellulomonas  sp. B6 
using experimental design  
 
Thaís Demarchi Mendes(1), Florencia E. Piccinni(2, 3), Thályta Fraga Pacheco(1), Thaís Fabiana Chan 
Salum(1), Paola Talia(2, 3), Eleonora Campos *(2, 3) , Mônica Caramez Triches Damaso  (1)  
(1) Embrapa Agroenergia, Av. W3 Norte (final), PqEB, s/no, CEP 70770 -901, Brasília, Brasil.  
(2) Instituto de Biotecnología, CICVyA, INTA. Los Reseros y Nicolás Repetto s/n. Hurlingham, Argentina.  
(3) Consejo Nacional de Investigaciones Científicas y Técni cas (CONICET), Buenos Aires, Argentina . 
 
Enzymatic complexes of cellulases are an essential tool to convert lignocellulosic 
materials  into fermentable sugars, which can be used to obtain organic acids, polyols 
and ethanol . Aerobic bacteria, as well as fung i, secrete multi -enzymatic complexes of 
hydrolases that present synergy among the enzymes involved.  The use of bacterial 
cellulases has the advantage of a higher range of pH and temperature tolerance. 
Moreover, bacteria can in general be more tolerant to e nvironmental stress in the 
production process and they also have higher growth rate compared to fungi. In this 
work, endoglucanase production by the cellulolytic bacteria Cellulomonas  sp. B6 was 
optimized using experimental design.  
By functional screening from a collection of cellulolytic bacterial strains isolated from 
different biomes, a strain of Cellulomonas  sp. was selected. The isolate, named B6, 
presented cellulolytic activity, and was capable of growing on cellulose, filter paper, and 
different sour ces of lignocellulosic biomasses as sole carbon source. In order to optimize 
endoglucanase production, firstly the effect on enzyme production of sugarcane 
bagasse, elephant grass and carboxymethylcellulose as carbon sources was studied in 
order to establi sh the most suitable substrate.  
The highest endoglucanase activity after 72h of cultivation was obtained using 
sugarcane bagasse (0.19 U/mL). Then, a Plackett -Burman experimental design was 
conducted to evaluate the influence of 12 variables in endoglucan ase production using 
this raw material. The variables evaluated were: pH, temperature, substrate and 
inoculum concentration, concentration of nitrogen sources (yeast extract, peptone, 
(NH 4)2SO 4 and NaNO 3 and concentration of salts (K 2HPO 4, MgSO 4, KCl and F eSO 4). 
Flasks were incubated at 150 rpm and after 48, 72 and 96 hours of fermentation, 
samples were removed and endoglucanase activity was determined. Sugarcane 
bagasse (substrate), KCl concentration and pH were the significant variables. Using 
these varia bles, a Central Composite Rotatable Design (CCRD) 23 was performed to 
optimize endoglucanase production. The highest endoglucanase activity was obtained 
after 72 h of cultivation (0.29 U/mL). This meant an improvement of 1.5 fold from initial 
conditions.  
Therefore, production of secreted cellulases of Cellulomonas  sp. B6 was optimized for 
endoglucanase activity. This extract will be evaluated for industrial applications.  
 
Keywords : Cellulomonas , cellulases, bacteria, experimental design, lignocellulosic ma terials

Its bioconversion requires the synergistic action of multiple xylanolytic enzymes, mainly 
endo -xylanases and β -xylosidases. Endo -xylanases (1,4 -β-D-xylan xylohydrolase, EC 
3.2.1.8) are considered one of the most important enzymes as they initiate the 
degradation of xylan into xylose and xylo -oligosaccharides of different sizes. The cost -
efficient degradation of xylan to fermentable sugars is of particular interest in second 
generation bioethanol production and in pulp and paper industries. The aim of this work 
was the cloning, heterologous expression and activity characterization of a potential 
endoxylanase from Paenibacillus  sp. A59 hemicellulolytic strain, isolated from forest soil.  
The complete xylanase coding sequence was identified in the rece ntly sequenced 
genome of Paenibacillus  sp. A59. The amino acid sequence analysis by NCBI -BLAST, 
resulted in high identity (98%) with a GH11 endoxylanase of Paenibacillus  sp. HY8, 
isolated from an herbivorous beetle. Conserved domains related to family GH11  
xylanase were identified and confirmed by PROSITE. Based on the nucleotide 
sequence, specific primers were designed for amplification, cloning and recombinant 
expression. The complete coding gene was amplified from Paenibacillus sp. A59 total 
DNA. The amp lification product was cloned and the recombinant protein was expressed 
with an N -terminal 6xHis fusion tag. Purification was performed with IMAC using Ni -NTA 
agarose resin.  
Xylanase activity was confirmed by hydrolysis of beechwood xylan, measuring the 
reducing sugars released by DNS as well as identifying and quantifying the main soluble 
products (xylotriose, xylobiose and xylose) by HPLC. Zimography was also performed in 
SDS-PAGE gels co -polymerized with xylan from beechwood. The recombinant enzyme 
show ed true endoxylanase activity with no activity on carboxymethyl cellulose, Avicel, 
PNP-cellobioside, xylo or glucopyranoside. We therefore named it Xyn11.  
Profiles of enzymatic activity at pH 3 to 10 and at 30°C to 70°C, as well as thermal 
tolerance were studied. Xyn11 showed optimal activity at pH 9 (retaining more than 60 
% activity from pH 4 to 8) and at 45°C (with more than 80 % activity from 40°C to 55°C). 
It showed good thermal stability, retaining at least 90% of xylanase activity after 120 
minutes at optimal conditions (45°C, pH 9). Michaelis -Menten enzyme kinetic 
parameters were also determined resulting in a K cat/KM constant of 3.11x105 seg-1 mg 
ml-1. 
These results indicate that Xyn11 is an alkaline cellulase free -xylanase. It has the 
potential to  be used in bioconversion of lignocellulosic biomass as well as biobleaching 
in the pulp and paper industry.

incidencia sobre la eficiencia en la generación de CLEAs de los siguientes factores:

enzima inmovilizada. En todos los casos, se observó que el efecto fue positivo en el

reducir la duración total del proceso de inmovilización a 2 h. F inalmente, la actividad

The oxygen electroreduction ov erpotential is one of the main contributions to the

effective electrocatalyst for electrodic reactions involved in hydrogen/oxygen proton 
exchange membrane (PEM) fuel  cell systems, particularly the oxygen electroreduction 
reaction. The morphology and crystalline orientation of Pt are very important factors to 
be considered for understanding the effect of the electrocatalyst surface structure on the 
kinetics of electroc atalytic reactions. In this work, the preparation and characterisation of 
(111) -type facetted Pt crystallites electrodeposited onto carbon -supported for using in 
PEM fuel cell are described. High surface area facetted Pt crystallites were obtained by 
apply ing a square wave potential pulse of high frequency in aqueous chloroplatinic acid 
at 25°C. The influence of upper potential limits, changing between 1,2 V and 1,38 V at 
fixed lower potential limit of -0,2 V, on the characteristics of the facetted Pt 
elect rocatalyst  as a function of electrodeposition time was evaluated. The development 
of facetting with preferential crystal orientation of the electrodeposited Pt nanoparticles 
was followed through the changes in the relative height of weakly and strongly bou nd H -
adatom voltammetric current peaks1. The surface morphology of the Pt nanoparticles 
was examined by using SEM and TEM techniques, and the characteristics of the 
crystalline structure were determined by X -ray diffractometry. The electrochemical active 
surface area of the Pt electrodeposits was determined through the hydrogen 
electrosorption charge by voltamperometric techniques . The characterization studies of 
metal electrodeposits revealed the presence of highly facetted Pt nanoparticles having a 
predom inant (111) preferential crystal orientation, which have shown a greater catalytic 
activity for the oxygen electroreduction reaction.  The Pt nanoparticles look like 
polyhedrons with predominance of triangular faces and acute angles, which is consistent 
with the development of the (111) preferential crystal orientation. The net charge for the 
electrodeposition process was determined through an electronic coulometer and the 
amount of Pt deposited was measured by using a  spectrophotometric method with a

La Cadena de Suministros (CS) forestal comprende desde las plantaciones de los 
árboles, materia prima fundamental para la mayoría de los productos, hasta la 
distribución de los productos a los clientes. A lo largo de esta cadena se generan 
diversos residuos (de las plantaciones) o  subproductos (chips, aserrín, etc.) en los 
aserraderos a partir de la producción de madera. Actualmente en Argentina, muchos de 
ellos no tienen un destino específico siendo, en varias oportunidades, quemados 
directamente sin un aprovechamiento. Un uso ade cuado de estos materiales 
representaría un desarrollo sustentable para estas industrias y agregaría valor a la 
cadena de producción.  
En este trabajo se propone una herramienta para evaluar alternativas de usos de los 
residuos y subproductos como materia pr ima para otros productos o como fuente de 
energía. De esta forma se enfatiza la importancia de reusar y reciclar material que, 
anteriormente, no tenía valor o el mismo era reducido. De esta forma, se considera 
conjuntamente el aspecto económico y ambiental   de las alternativas disponibles. Para 
esto se formula un modelo matemático que permite optimizar variables de interés dentro 
de la CS planteada , donde diferentes decisiones son incluidas, como: ubicación, 
cantidad y tamaño de cada unidad de producción a instalarse, destino de residuos de 
poda y cosecha, destino de subproductos, transporte entre nodos, etc.  
Para evaluar el aspecto ambiental se utiliza las emisiones de gases de efecto 
invernadero provocado por las calderas y el transporte. En particular, re sulta una 
decisión significativa el tipo y tamaño de caldera a instalar para cada proceso productivo 
y el tipo de insumo utilizado en éstas. En este último caso se considera el uso de 
residuos forestales y combustible, lo cual influye en la disponibilidad de materia prima, 
en el costo y en el impacto ambiental. Debido a que existen diversos compromisos entre 
aspectos económicos y ambientales en los sistemas productivos, se recurre a la 
metodología ε-constraint, la cual permite confrontar estos aspectos en l a CS 
considerada. Los resultados muestran la importancia de considerar la variable 
ambiental dentro de la configuración de sistemas productivos forestales. Existe una 
tendencia en utilizar todos los residuos y subproductos como materia prima de otros 
produ ctos y como fuente de energía. Por otro lado se demuestra la importancia de 
considerar diversos tipos de unidades de producción y distintos tipos de calderas para 
el diseño sustentable de la cadena. La herramienta propuesta permite analizar y decidir 
sobre  diferentes cuestiones económicas y ambientales al momento de diseñar vínculos 
entre productores -consumidores de la industria forestal. Es un instrumento qué, desde 
la ingeniería ambiental, puede ser aplicado para lograr diseños sustentables de 
sistemas fo restales, y ser utilizado a la hora de una evaluación ambiental considerando 
los compromisos con aspectos económicos.

Agriculture contributes to the water quality degradation through the nutrients lea ching 
to groundwater and further other water bodies (estuarine, rivers, lakes, sea, and 
especially water wells used for irrigation). Thus, this groundwater deterioration occurs 
overall by the increase in nutrients associated with soil mineral fertilization  (like nitrogen 
and phosphorus). This problem is highlighted in areas with the groundwater already 
contaminated, or zones with permeable soils, or wherein the water table is shallow, 
which results particularly important in islands. A sustainable nutrient m anagement at 
field requires mitigating aquatic and atmospheric emissions. For this, some guidance 
and management tools should be need and equitable in every respect (environmental, 
at the plant nutritional level and economical and, upon the plants health a nd soils).  The 
guidance tools established by each country and generally by the European Union need 
field investigation conducted on -site (above all else, in nitrogen fertilization) for writing 
useful directives, which they should support to environmentally  sound agriculture 
practices, rational and integrated with the crop type and soil.  
Sa Pobla located in the north -east of Majorca Island, in the Mediterranean Sea, and 
situated in the main area agricultural of the island (known as Inca -Sa Pobla Plan), 
prese nts an elevated concentration of nitrates in groundwater, which in year 2000, this 
area has been declared by the authorities as a "Nitrate Vulnerable Zone”. 
Notwithstanding, it heavily depends of irrigation from groundwater resources and urban 
waters, beca use there are intensive potato agriculture practices. That’s why, the main 
objective of this work was discern between different fertilization strategies in potato crop, 
for understanding which one of them would be the best for providing the minimum 
impact on nutrient losses, from soil toward surrounding environment, through 
groundwater. Six treatments were carried out through the use of four fertilizers 
(Ammonium sulphate, Duramon, Nitrofoska, and Potassium sulphate) that they were 
applied in two manners (t he basal dressing and the top -dressing). All treatments were 
done by quadruplicated, with an experimental design in such a way that there were 3 
treatments with the two ways of fertilizer application, 2 treatments only with the basal 
fertilization and 1 co ntrol treatment, without fertilizer. Results showed that in the balance 
analysis between the environmental cost (conservation and quality of soil) and the 
economic cost (the production yield in potato kg and the fertilizers cost) that, in general, 
the most  favorable treatments were the fertilization applied in the top soil and the basal 
dressing, especially with fertilizers of sulphates salts (ammonium and phosphate). These 
fertilizers could be highlighted by the soil type, highly calcareous.

biotechnological tools and treatment systems that avoid potential d amage to human 
health and the environment. Some Actinobacteria have been described as OPs -
degraders. However, there are very few reports about this special and scarcely studied 
group of microorganisms. Mixed cultures of Streptomyces  spp. have demonstrated to be 
more effective at removing the toxic compounds than pure cultures. Therefore, the aim 
of this study was to evaluate the ability of a mixed culture of Streptomyces  spp. to 
remove a OPs mixture from different environmental matrices.  
Analytical grade c hlorpyrifos and diazinon were used. To form the Streptomyces spp. 
mixed culture, four strains characterized by their ability to tolerate and degrade OPs 
were assayed. The pesticides added in mixture (100 mg L-1) were evaluated in liquid 
medium with and wit hout glucose. Samples were collected and microbial growth, 
live/dead cells, pesticide concentrations and the main metabolites were analysed at 
different times. In addition, chlorpyrifos and diazinon (100 mg kg-1) removal was studied 
in sterilized soil and a bio -mixture used in biobed treatment systems. After pesticide and 
mixed culture application, soil and biomixture were incubated for 28 days. During this 
time, enzymatic activities as dehydrogenase and acid phosphatase were measured, as 
well as the pestic ide residues.

medium which was confirmed by the presence of their metabolites 3, 5, 6 -trichloro -2-
pyridinol and 2 -isopropyl -6-methyl -4-pyrimidinol. The mixed culture used the pesticides 
mixture to grow, which was observed after 24 h of incubation. Glucose addition 
decreased biomass duplication time of the culture and also increased the metabolite 
concentration in the liquid medium. After pesticides mixture removal, about 85% li ve 
cells and 15% death cells were observed. The bioaugmentation performed in soils and 
biomixture showed that the inoculum was able to colonize the substrate. The highest 
values of enzymatic activity were observed in the bio -mixture. However, this high 
microbial activity was no representative of a greater pesticides removal. After 28 days of 
incubation, 52% of diazinon and 14% of chlorpyrifos were removed from sterilized soil.

La disposición de sedimentos dragados sobre el suelo puede afectar negativamente 
el ambiente debido a las altas concentraciones de metales pesados y compuestos 
orgánicos que suelen contener, fund amentalmente cuando provienen de ríos urbanos.  
Diversos factores físicos, químicos y biológicos afectan la disponibilidad de los 
contaminantes del sedimento. Consecuentemente, los efectos adversos que los 
contaminantes pueden causar a receptores ecológicos  (plantas, microorganismos y 
animales), pueden variar entre sedimentos  de diferentes características. Diversos 
estudios han demostrado la influencia que contaminantes inorgánicos y orgánicos 
pueden tener sobre la germinación y el desarrollo de diversas pla ntas comúnmente 
utilizadas como bioindicadores de contaminación ambiental. Los ensayos de toxicidad 
permiten evaluar los efectos fitotóxicos de compuestos puros o de mezclas complejas 
en el proceso de germinación de las semillas y en el desarrollo de las p lántulas durante 
los primeros días de crecimiento. El objetivo de este trabajo fue evaluar la toxicidad de 
sedimentos del río Matanza -Riachuelo y principales arroyos afluentes utilizando como 
especie diagnóstico Lactuca sativa  1. Se realizaron muestreos en  nueve sitios de la 
cuenca Matanza -Riachuelo, abarcando ambientes agropecuarios, periurbanos, y 
urbanos -industriales. Cuatro de ellos en la cuenca alta, tres en la cuenca media y dos 
en la zona baja de la cuenca. Se prepararon extractos acuosos de los sedi mentos 
muestreados combinando 50g de muestra con 100ml de agua desionizada. Las 
suspensiones fueron agitadas durante 3h y posteriormente filtradas. Se realizaron 
bioensayos de toxicidad agudos (120 hs de exposición) y estáticos, exponiendo semillas 
de Lactuca sativa  a diferentes diluciones de los extractos (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%, 
12,5%, 6%, 3% y 1,5%). Se evaluó la elongación radicular (ER%), el índice de 
germinación (IG%) y la longitud del hipocótilo. En tres de los sitios muestreados (dos de 
la cuenca baja y uno de la cuenca media) se observaron disminuciones significativas 
(p<0,05) de ER%, IG% y de la longitud del hipocótilo, con respecto al control negativo 
(agua desionizada). En los restantes sitios de la cuenca media (zona periurbana con 
establecimientos  industriales dispersos) no se detectaron variaciones con respecto al 
control. En la cuenca alta (uso del suelo principalmente agropecuario) tres de los cuatro 
sitios no evidenciaron diferencias significativas (p<0,05) con el control para ninguno de 
los pa rámetros analizados, mientras que en el sitio restante se registró una leve 
disminución en las longitudes de radícula e hipocótilo, sin detectarse una alteración en 
su IG%.  Los resultados de este trabajo mostraron que el bioensayo de toxicidad 
utilizando s emillas de Lactuca sativa permitió diferenciar ambientes contrastantes de la 
cuenca y servirá como punto de partida para la evaluación de la calidad de sedimentos 
del río Matanza -Riachuelo, contribuyendo así a establecer posibles planes de 
saneamiento o re localización de los materiales dragados.

It is increasingly recognized that metal bioavailability is a better indicator of the 
potential for phytoremediation than the total metal concentration in soils . Therefore, an 
understanding of the influence of phytoremediation plants on metal dynamics at the soil -
root interface is increasingly vital for the successful implementation of this remediation 
technique. In this study, we investigated the chemical change s in pore water solution, 
and rhizosphere microbial diversity, after growth of two genotypes of Silene vulgaris  and 
the subsequent chromium (Cr) uptake, in two contrasting soils spiked with an industrial 
sludge with high content in Cr.

alkaline and poor in OM soil. In general, irrespective of plant genotype, type of soil and 
sludge treatment, the concentrations of dissolved organic carbon (DOC), dissolved 
inorganic carbon  (DIC) and pH values were enhanced in the rhizosphere compared to 
the bulk soil. Genotype effect on Cr availability was only observed in alkaline soil. In this 
soil, significant differences were found between the two genotypes with respect to Cr 
uptake in roots and biomass.  
The clustering analysis of denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis (DGGE) of 16S 
rDNA fragments revealed that major differences in bacterial community structure were 
related to sludge treatment, followed by soil type and finally, plant g enotype. Bacterial 
diversity comparison through Richness, Shannon -Weaver and Eveness indices showed 
the higher diversity after sludge treatment. Rhizosphere soils were more diverse in 
alkaline soil and, in both soils significant differences were observed b etween genotypes.

those from neutral soil were more related to OM.

polluted soils. Although in a lkaline and poor in OM soils, root exudates may contribute to 
a higher microbial diversity, the largest amount of available Cr can be a limiting factor on 
these remediation strategies. In such cases, organic soil amendments would facilitate 
the soil resili ence against a pollution source.

environmental pollutants such as chl orinated organic compounds, metals, metalloids 
and inorganic anions. Although most of the studies have been performed in water 
samples, the effectiveness of nZVI to remediate contaminated soils has recently 
attracted attention.  
An old mining -industrial sit e called El Terronal, located in Asturias (northern of Spain) 
and highly polluted with As and Hg was selected for the study. The objective was 
determine the effectiveness of nZVI to reduce the As and Hg availability in the 
brownfield soil, and determine it s viability as a strategy to remediate this site. Previous 
experiments performed by this research group have shown that the use of nZVI could be 
an adequate strategy to recover the land use in As polluted soils.

metal(loid) concentration, especially for As. The mean concentrations of As and Hg in A -
zone were 69000 and 2900 mg/kg, respectively, and in the case of B -zone they were 
26000 and 2800 mg/kg, respectively. Different do ses of nZVI (Nanofer 25S, 
NANOIRON) were tested: 0, 1, 5 and 10%. The potential mobility and availability of As 
and Hg in soil samples was evaluated using the TCLP test (Toxicity characteristics 
leaching procedure) according to the USEPA Method 1311 (1992)  and the sequential 
extraction procedure proposed by Tessier et al. (1979).  
The application of nZVI significantly reduced the As and Hg availability in the 
brownfield soil samples, and the best results were observed for As. The As 
concentration in more av ailable fractions (exchangeable and bounded to carbonates) 
significantly decreased whereas a significant increase of As in the residual fraction was 
observed. In the same way, the potential leachability determined according to the TCLP 
test was reduced aft er the addition of nZVI. The best immobilization results were 
obtained at the doses of 5 and 10%. Poorer immobilization results were obtained in the 
case of Hg. The Hg in exchangeable fraction decreased by 73 and 79% for the A and B 
zone, respectively, but  a significant reduction of Hg in TCLP extracts was not observed. 
In conclusion, the application of nZVI to highly As and Hg polluted soils is a promising 
remediation strategy although the study of combined strategies including other types of 
nanoparticles  or other remediation techniques would be appropriate to improve the 
immobilization of mercury.

The design of effective interventions for restoration of polluted groundwater is a 
challenging task and the individuation of innovative in -situ technologies has attracted 
many researchers in the last years. Permeable Adsorptive Barriers (PABs) are a passive 
in-situ technique for remediation of polluted groundwater, which are based on the use  of 
adsorption processes for pollutant removal. This technique consists in the insertion of a 
permeable wall made of adsorbing material (e.g. activated carbon) into the contaminated 
aquifer, which is able to intercept the polluted water flowing under the n atural hydraulic 
gradient and to retain the contaminants by adsorption on a solid surface.  
Design and optimization of a PAB require to take into account both technical 
assessments (i.e. the hydrological and geotechnical properties of the entire polluted 
aquifer, the pollutant type and the contaminated area extension, the adsorbing material, 
etc.) and economic evaluations (i.e. the overall cost of intervention). Different solutions 
are currently available, even if each of them presents some limits in realiza tion, and 
secondary effects, such as environmental impact, treatment time and costs, which drive 
to further investigations aimed at process optimization.  
This work deals with the design and optimization of a PAB for the remediation of 
thallium contaminated  groundwater in the area of Caserta province in south of Italy. 
Preliminary lab -scale experimental tests were carried out in order to define the thallium 
adsorption capacity of a selected activated carbon, in operating conditions typical of 
groundwater. A numerical model was developed to simulate pollutant transport in the 
aquifer and adsorption mechanisms onto the adsorbent material. The study was realized 
by a Computational Fluid Dynamic approach, developed in COMSOL® Multiphysics 
environment and therefor e using a finite element model. Different PAB configurations, 
i.e. a ‘continuous’ trench and ‘discontinuous’ separate wells were studied and compared 
for the sake of an optimization of the intervention.  
The PAB design procedure allowed the individuation o f barrier location and 
orientation and the definition of its dimensions for both configurations (i.e. length, height, 
and width for continuous PAB and number of wells, distance between wells and well 
diameter for the discontinuous PAB) and, finally, the de termination of the amount of 
adsorbing material.  
Modelling results show that a PAB is an effective remediation technique of the 
contaminated aquifer, being thallium concentration flowing out the barrier always lower 
than Italian regulatory limit over a lar ge span of time, hence assuring also a long -term 
groundwater protection.

La presencia de altas concentraciones de Mn en aguas subterráneas de consumo 
humano es un problema ampliamente distribuido en Argentina y en el m undo, ya que 
afecta su calidad desde el punto de vista sanitario, operativo y de aceptabilidad. En los 
últimos años se han desarrollado métodos de remoción biológica de metales. En 
diversas plantas de tratamiento de aguas de consumo de la región de la prov incia de 
Santa Fe se utiliza el proceso denominado BioCIS -UNR®, que consta de un sistema de 
doble filtración en el cual los metales oxidados por las bacterias naturales  son retenidos 
en filtros de arena. El biofilm bacteriano que se forma en estos filtros de arena, actúa 
como un buffer químico inmovilizando los metales y los productos de oxidación 
biológica de los mismos. Sin embargo, el principal problema en la implementación del 
proceso tiene que ver con los extensos tiempos requeridos para la maduración de estos 
biofilms en los filtros y la remoción del Mn.  
En estudios previos realizados en nuestro laboratorio se analizó la capacidad 
formadora de biofilms y de oxidación de Mn (II) de bacterias obtenidas a partir de 
muestras provenientes de aguas con alto  contenido de Mn . En este trabajo se propone 
optimizar la combinación de los diferentes aislados que presentaron una  alta capacidad 
de oxidación de Mn y de formación de biofilms . Esta optimización permitirá desarrollar 
un inóculo bacteriano utilizable para filtros de arena de nuevas plantas de tratamiento 
de aguas, a fin de reducir el tiempo de maduración de los mismos para la remoción 
biológica del Mn.  
Se diseñaron filtros de arena a escala laboratorio para simular lo que ocurre en las 
plantas reales. Los mismos se operaron inoculando diferentes combinaciones de 
bacterias, que incluyen los géneros Pseudomonas, Noviherbaspirillum, Terrabacter y 
Flavobacterium . Asimismo, se evaluaron distintas formas de formulación del inóculo, 
tales como crecimiento de las b acterias a partir de cultivo estático y en agitación.  Las 
columnas se operaron en batch y bajo condiciones de flujos continuos. A partir de 
métodos microbiológicos se determinó la presencia de los distintos géneros bacterianos 
ensayados en las distintas et apas del proceso.  
Los resultados muestran que todas las bacterias del inóculo tienen la capacidad de 
adherirse a la arena y se produce  la bioacumulación de óxidos de Mn en filtros 
inoculados con mezclas de los cuatro géneros bacterianos ensayados. Además,  el 
proceso de adherencia y retención del inóculo en la arena está favorecido si los filtros 
operan de manera continua y si el inóculo se desarrolla a partir de crecimiento estático 
de las bacterias.  Nuevos estudios determinarán si la implementación de est a 
metodología de inoculación es factible para optimizar los procesos de remoción 
biológica de Fe y Mn a escala real.

El Fe y el Mn son elementos comunes en la superficie de la tierra. El agua que se 
filtra a través del suelo y las formaciones ge ológicas puede disolver estos minerales y 
acarrearlos hacia el agua subterránea, afectando su calidad desde el punto de vista de 
aceptabilidad, operativo y sanitario. En los últimos años, los métodos de remoción 
biológica de Mn han cobrado fuerza debido a su alta eficiencia, bajo costo y sin impacto 
ambiental negativo. Estos métodos consisten en la utilización de filtros que retienen 
bacterias endógenas con capacidad de oxidar metales. Los óxidos formados quedan 
retenidos en estos biofilms bacterianos y el agua filtrada se obtiene libre de metales. En 
estos procesos se ha observado que resulta muy fácil la remoción de Fe, pero no así la 
del Mn. Los tiempos de maduración para los filtros biológicos, pueden variar de 
semanas a meses y el éxito de la maduración  de un biofiltro para la remoción de Mn 
puede diferir mucho entre dos plantas de tratamiento, aún con la misma calidad de agua 
cruda, dependiendo principalmente de la calidad bacteriológica de esta última.  
En nuestro laboratorio, partir de muestras de agua s con alto contenido de Mn se 
aislaron bacterias capaces de oxidar este metal utilizando diversos medios selectivos. 
En este trabajo se realizó un estudio comparativo de la capacidad de oxidación de Mn y 
formadora de biofilms de estas bacterias oxidantes d e Mn (II), seleccionadas e 
identificadas previamente.  
Se analizaron 166 aislamientos, pertenecientes a quince géneros bacterianos. En 
todos los casos, para estudiar la eficiencia de oxidación de Mn (II), se realizaron 
ensayos en medios sólidos. A distinto s tiempos (días) se cuantificó la oxidación con el 
colorante Azul de Leucoberbelina (LBB), que en presencia de óxidos de Mn es oxidado 
produciendo un color azul, con un máximo de absorción a 618 nm. La oxidación se 
normalizó a la cantidad de proteínas tota les (mg/ml). Luego se realizaron ensayos de 
biofilms de los mejores oxidantes caracterizados. Para ello, los cultivos bacterianos se 
incubaron estáticamente durante 7, 14 y 21 días a 30ºC, en presencia o ausencia de 
MnCl 2 100 M. Transcurridos los distinto s tiempos de incubación, los biofilms fueron 
revelados agregando solución de Cristal Violeta (CV) 0.1% (p/v) que se une a las 
membranas bacterianas.  
En cuanto a la capacidad de oxidación de Mn, se destacaron cuatro aislamientos 
pertenecientes a los género s Pseudomonas, Noviherbaspirillum, Terrabacter y 
Flavobacterium . Además, todos ellos fueron capaces de formar biofilms.   
Estudios futuros de estos aislamientos conducirán al desarrollo un inóculo bacteriano 
capaz de optimizar tiempos de remoción biológica de Mn en las plantas de tratamientos 
de aguas.

hazardous aspects concerning these radionuclides, relates to the final disposal of solid

increased interest  in the development of efficient remediation and recovery methods 
given that actinides such as Uranium and Thorium are associated with acidic mine

mismas para generar metano. Entre las biomasas convencional es se encuentran 
residuos de la industria alimenticia, sólidos urbanos, lodos de depuradora y estiércoles 
mientras que entre las menos estudiadas se encuentran las biomasas de tipo 
lignocelulósicas obtenidas a partir de cultivos energéticos u otros subprod uctos de la 
industria de alimentos como es la producción de hongos comestibles.

lignocelulósicas como son el silaje de sorgo (de diferente contenido de azúcares) y el

con la finalidad de evaluar su potencial de producción de metano. Se desarrollaron 
ensayos en bioreactores batch a escala laboratorio, en régimen mesofílico (35 °C), 
utilizando como in óculo lodos de depuradora . Se estudiaron tres relaciones 
sustrato/inóculo S/I 1:1, 1:2 y 2:1 ( expresadas en unidades de sólidos volátiles) con la 
finalidad de evaluar la mezcla que optimice el proceso. Se aplicó un diseño 
experimental por duplicado y cada ensayo se controló hasta el momento en que no se 
detectó producción de metano lo cual varió según las biomasas entre 40 y 105 días. Se 
midió periódicamente tanto el volumen como la composición del biogás producido .

mL/g VS para sorgo biosilero, silero y el residuo de hongos respectivamente. La mayor 
capacidad de producción de metano se observó en el sorgo biosilero para la relación S/I

no se observaron diferencias significativas en la producción de metano para ninguna de 
las tres relaciones S/I aplicadas. El residuo de la producción de hongos ( aserrín de 
álamo degradado) mostró la menor producc ión de metano la cual puede explicarse a 
partir tanto de la baja concentración de inóculo utilizada como de la naturaleza del

un insumo de interés para los procesos industriales. Un ejemplo de ello es el uso de 
proteasas en  el proceso de depilado aplicado en la industria del cuero. La mayoría de 
las curtiembres utilizan durante el depilado altas proporciones de Na 2S y/o CaS, 
resultando efluentes de alta alcalinidad, alto contenido de sólidos en suspensión, 
además del SH 2 tóxico. El reemplazo del sulfuro por proteasas (depilado enzimático) 
constituye una alternativa biotecnología ampliamente estudiada en las últimas décadas 
con aplicaciones exitosas.  
El objetivo del presente trabajo fue evaluar extractos ricos en proteasas obt enidos de 
frutos de especies vegetales de la familia Bromeliaceae: Bromelia balansae  (Bb), B. 
hieronymi  (Bh) y Pseudananas macrodontes  (Pm) como posibles insumos eco -
compatibles para la industria del curtido. Las proteasas de dichos extractos han sido 
caracterizadas como cisteínicas y han mostrado alta actividad proteolítica frente a la 
caseína (U Ca).

sustratos representativos de la piel: azul de queratina (queratina), HPA (colág eno),

denominadas U Ker, UHPA, UEl y U Ep, respectivamente. Los ensayos se realizaron a 25ºC,

depilante fue evaluada mediante la incubación de piezas de piel vacuna (20% p/v) con 
cada extracto proteolítico en el buffer antes mencionado a diferentes concentraciones

usó un depilante enzimático comercial.

ensayados. A 35ºC el extracto proteolítico de Bh mostró la máxima actividad frente a 
keratina, colágeno y el sustrato epidermis (1,2±0,5 UKer/mg, 346±13 UHPA/mg y 3,8 ±0,9 
UEp/mg, respectivamente ); en tanto que Bb fue el extracto que exhibió la mayor 
actividad elastinolítica ( 3,8±0,07 U Ep/mg). El producto comercial mostró actividades algo

reconoci do como seguro (GRAS) por la FDA. El ZnO puede prepararse con morfologías 
muy variadas y, por otro lado, posee propiedades bactericidas que se potencian bajo 
iluminación UVA.  
El objetivo de este trabajo es evaluar el efecto de la incorporación de dos tipos  de 
nanobarras de ZnO con propiedades fisicoquímicas y relación de aspecto similares, 
pero de diferente tamaño, sobre el comportamiento de películas de ZnO/almidón. Dos 
conjuntos de nanobarras de ZnO de diferente tamaño se sintetizaron por vía 
hidrotermal.  Las películas se prepararon por casteo, conteniendo el mismo porcentaje 
en peso de ZnO. Se estudió la permeabilidad al vapor de agua, humedad, solubilidad y 
ángulo de contacto, las características estructurales mediante DRX y FTIR, la 
biodegradabilidad en  suelo y agua y la actividad antibacteriana.  
La incorporación de nanobarras de ZnO aumentó el ángulo de contacto y disminuyó 
el contenido de humedad, la solubilidad y la permeabilidad al vapor de agua de las 
películas. Los estudios estructurales mostraron que esto se relaciona con la interacción 
entre el almidón y las nanobarras de ZnO, las cuales son más hidrofóbicas que el 
almidón. Al aumentar el tamaño de las nanobarras, disminuyó el contenido de 
humedad, la solubilidad, la permeabilidad de vapor de agua  y la cristalinidad de los 
materiales compuestos. El fenómeno se asignó a un cambio en el empaquetamiento de 
las moléculas de almidón en las películas.  Los ensayos microbiológicos mostraron que 
las nanobarras de ZnO confirieron propiedades antibacterianas,  aumentando el tiempo 
necesario para biodegradar los films y su vida útil. Los compuestos con nanobarras de 
menor tamaño presentaron mayor actividad antimicrobiana y mayor tiempo de 
biodegradación, probablemente debido a su mayor área superficial.  
En concl usión, se determinó fehacientemente el efecto del tamaño de la nanocarga 
(manteniendo constante la relación de aspecto y concentración másica de ZnO) sobre 
las propiedades fisicoquímicas y antimicrobianas de las películas ZnO/almidón. Estos 
resultados cont ribuyen a comprender el funcionamiento de estos sistemas y al diseño 
de nuevos materiales funcionales de bajo impacto ambiental.

eliminating this plague are limited, in this paper the application of new material such as

De acuerdo con la FAO en el 2014 el alto consumo de carne de aves (108.7 millones 
de toneladas),  generan toneladas de plumas, consideradas residuos que afectan la 
salud pública y el ambiente.E n México se estima que para el año 2018 el consumo total 
de pollo será de 3,274 millones de toneladas, lo cual significa que se generarán 
alrededor de 163.7 a 3 27.4 millones de toneladas de plumas. Los procesos de 
biodegradación de plumas con mayor impacto a nivel internacional emplean cepas 
puras, sin embargo, en México son escasos los estudios sobre éste tema.El objetivo de 
la presente investigación fue estandar izar las condiciones óptimas para la 
biodegradación de plumas de pollo a nivel laboratorio.  
El estudio se realizó en matraces de un litro con un consorcio de bacterias aislado de 
una procesadora de pollos. Las condiciones del cultivo fueron agitación a 120  rpm y pH 
de 6.8 -7.2 durante 14 días. En la primera etapa se propuso un diseño experimental 
23.Los factores evaluados fueron: temperatura (25, 32 y 37°C) y fuente de carbono 
(suero de leche, caldo nutritivo y caldo Luria Bertani). En la segunda etapa se eva luó la 
degradación de la pluma a diferentes concentraciones de caldo nutritivo (25, 50 y 
100%) .Para evaluar la degradación de la pluma se cuantificó la concentración de 
proteína (Bradford, 1976) y se determinó la presencia de algunos aminoácidos 
aromáticos por espectrofotometría de luz UV en la parte soluble después del proceso de 
la degradación de las plumas.  
Los resultados mostraron que el método propuesto permite la total degradación de 
las plumas  (incluyendo el raquis). En la primer etapa las mejores con diciones de 
operación fueron con caldo nutritivo y 32 °C. En la segunda etapa la degradación total 
de la pluma fue usando caldo nutritivo al 50% y a 32 °C.Durante el proceso se forman 
estructuras redondas o elípticas como una estrategia para la degradación  total de las 
plumas. La máxima concentración de proteína obtenida en la parte soluble después del 
proceso de degradación a 32 °C y con 25, 50 y 100 % de caldo nutritivo fue de 18.30, 
20.50 y 24.29 mg/mLrespectivamente. Algunos aminoácidos presentes fueron  triptófano 
y tirosina. El presente estudio es parte de una tecnología biotecnológica prometedora 
para la disminución de contaminación por plumas. Los aminoácidos obtenidos al 
finalizar el proceso tienen un alto potencial industrial.

lípidos y carbohidratos por especie, siendo la iluminación uno de los factores que 
afectan la producción. Por tanto, la temperatura cromática (espectro de luz) es factor

Esto conlleva a la disolución de m etales que están asociados a las rocas del carbón. 
Hierro (Fe), manganeso (Mn), aluminio (Al), cobre (Cu) y níquel (Ni), entre otros metales 
pesados, suelen contaminar los recursos hídricos, ecosistemas y, consecuentemente, 
se compromete la salud humana. E l tratamiento de este tipo de aguas mediante 
sistemas pasivos que se basan en aumentar el pH e generar alcalinidad para provocar 
una posterior precipitación de los metales ha sido demostrado como la mejor 
alternativa.  
A pesar que el potencial de las conch as de ostra para remover metales pesados de 
distintos tipos de efluentes ha sido constatado en varios estudios (Hsu1; Yan -Jiao et al.2; 
Du et al.3) aún no ha sido utilizado este adsorbente natural para remover los metales 
pesados presentes en los DAM. Con este trabajo se pretende (i) estudiar el potencial 
para remover los metales pesados (Al, Fe y Mn) e (ii) evaluar el potencial para 
neutralizar el pH mediante conchas de ostra en los DAM. Para lograr estos objetivos se 
realizaron experimentos en sistema bat ch teniendo en cuenta la agitación, el tiempo de 
contacto, el tamaño de grano, el efecto de la dosis de sorbente y la temperatura.

orden de remoción de los metales fue Al>F e>Mn. El pH final conseguido fue mayor que 
8. Se concluye que la calcita biogénica presenta una excelente remoción de los metales 
citados presentes en la agua de estudio e, por consiguiente, existe un potencial 
importante para la aplicación de las conchas de ostra en un sistema pasivo de 
tratamiento de DAM, considerando el potencial para neutralizar el pH. El tratamiento 
propuesto de DAM es innovador y sostenible, ya que entra en el campo de las 
tecnologías de bajo costo y de reaprovechamiento de residuos.

This contribution presents recent results on the structure, self -assembly, and 
functionality of biological plywood materials1, an ubiquitous material organization found 
throughout Nature, including plant cell walls, exocuticles of insects, bone, and cornea. 
The key objective is to demonstrate the principles used by Nature to develop stiff, 
strong, tough, multifunctional materials from simple rod -like filaments.  
A systematic multiscale modelling based on liquid crystal material physics is used to 
characterize t he formation of these plywoods through chiral directed self -assembly. The 
role of orientational diffusivity in the temporal kinetics is established. In real system, 
second phases, curved confinements lead to defects and imperfections which here are 
shown t o follow topological features determined by the plywoods architecture.  
Practical characterization usually involves cross -sectioning followed by microscopy.

orientation of the plywoods. The approach is validated with cornea -like tissues and with 
the exocuticle of a beetle.

responsible for optical functionalities and cell growth. In the forme r, we develop and 
apply a model to explain the diffraction patterns and color changes in tulips.

govern the formation of biological plywoods for armor and strength as w ell as 
functionalities such as structural color.

Polystyrene divinylbenzene -based ion exchange resins are employed extensively 
within nuclear power plants (NPP) and in research reactors for chemical control of the 
cooling water system. To maintain the highest possible w ater quality the resins are 
regularly replaced as they become contaminated with a range of fission product isotopes 
derived from compromised fuel elements as well as corrosion and activation products 
including 14C, 60Co, 90Sr, 129I and 137Cs. Such spent re sins constitute a major proportion 
(in volume terms) of the solid radioactive waste generated by the nuclear industry1. 
Several treatment and conditioning techniques have been developed with a view toward 
reducing the spent resin volume and generating a st able waste product suitable for long -
term storage and disposal. Pyrolysis is one of the most effective thermal methods and is 
characterized as a low temperature flameless process (compared with high temperature 
thermal methods, e.g. incineration) in which the organic material is heated in a reducing 
atmosphere to leave a carbonaceous product or char. Several successful commercial 
applications in the nuclear industry, such as THORsm in USA, were conducted and the 
Pettersson et al.2 leading experience is the reference of actually developed processes. 
Another major advantage of pyrolysis is that a large part of radioactive inventory is 
confined within the product. This simplifies the treatment of the flue gases since little or 
no radioactivity is expected to be  present.  In the present work we discuss results relating 
to the pyrolysis of spent resins and the treatment of the off -gas generated during the 
process.  A stable and chemically inert waste product  was obtained for pyrolysis 
treatment at temperatures betwe en 300 and 350°C. The samples showed a significant 
volume reduction (>50%) and a high retention of the semi -volatile radionuclides in the 
matrix. As part of the present investigation the process off -gas was thoroughly 
characterized.  Additionally, the appli cation of plasma technology for the treatment of the 
off-gas current was studied as an alternative to conventional processes (e.g. post -
combustion chamber). A laboratory scale system, using inductively coupled plasma 
(ICP), operating under sub -atmospheric conditions was developed. Fundamental 
experiments using model compounds have been performed and these have 
demonstrated a high destruction and removal ratio (>99,99%) for different reaction 
medias, at low reactor temperatures, moderate power consumption an d using H 2O as 
reagent in plasma conditions.  The combination of both processes could represent a 
simple, safe and effective alternative for treating spent resins and any gaseous 
byproducts generated.

Legislative requirements in advanced countries stipulate acceptable procedures for 
the disposal, processing and application of animal manures. However, with regard to 
complexity of processes that take place in stored an imal manures and affect 
devitalisation of potential pathogens, there are still some aspects that may raise hygiene 
risks and require further investigations.

carriers with Ascaris suum  eggs were introduced into the slurry in order to observe their 
devitalization during storage under different conditions (4o, 20o and 42oC). Ascaris suum 
eggs stored in distilled water at the respective temperatures served as a control. Plate 
counts of S. typhimurium and the number of devitalised non -embryonated model Ascaris 
suum  eggs were determined on days 0, 7, 12, 22, 32, 40, 55, 90 and 115 of storage. In 
addition, plate counts of E. coli  and faecal streptococci in the stored slurry were als o 
monitored. In the above mentioned intervals we carried out also physico -chemical 
examination of slurry to determine changes  in pH, dry mater (DM), chemical oxygen 
demand (C OD) and ammonium ions (NH 4+) that may support devitalization of 
pathogens .

days at 4oC and for less than 90 days at 20oC and 42oC. E. coli  was no more recovered 
after 90 days of storage at 20o C and faecal streptococci after 115 days of storage at 
42oC. Devitalization of A. suum  eggs was affected by temperature and the time of 
storage but complete devitalization was not achieved even after 115 days at 42oC.

however, there wer e some variations requiring further study.

conclusions regarding their potential influence on devitalization of S. typhimurium  and

parasitic risk related to application of pig slurry to soil even after 115 days of storage.

of legislative provisions.

donde se emplean organismos con metabolismos particulares que permiten la 
utilización de hidrocarburos como fuente de carbono. Generalmente se usan 
microorganismos bacterianos en estos procesos por sus ciclos rápidos de repro ducción

capacidades bacterianas para biodegradar hidrocarburos aromáticos policíclicos1

plantas colectadas en la localidad “Las Minas” (Provincia del Napo, Ecuador). Esta zona

concluye en el Río San Juan y que es vital para muchas poblaciones cercanas.

Metallothioneins (MTs) are a ubiquitous family of cysteine rich proteins, deeply 
responsive to a wide range of stress factors and among them, specially heavy metals. 
Their main functions  are related to heavy metal storage and detoxification. Animal and 
fungi MTs are highly characterized, by contrast, data on plant metallothioneins are 
limited, even though many MT isoforms are present in their genomes. Considering plant 
metallothionein pot ential for bioremediation processes, two soybean MT isoforms were 
selected for further studies: GmMT1 and GmMT3, the most highly expressed isoforms in 
roots and shoots, respectively. Soybean, the worldwide main source of oil and high 
protein feeds for the livestock sector, has a high Cd accumulation capacity, and in all 
three cadmium levels tested the concentration of the metal accumulated in the vegetal 
tissues analyzed was higher than the available cadmium in the corresponding soil.  
Soybean MTs, purified from E.coli  cells cultured in different metal rich media, are able 
to bind Cu, Cd and Zn with high stoichiometries. When these MTs are heterologously 
expressed in S. cerevisiae  both proteins restore Cu tolerance and marginally improve Zn 
tolerance of MT -null yeast strains, but GmMT3 is better for coping with Cd stress. 
Moreover, A. thaliana  plants expressing soybean MTs under the CaMV35S promoter are 
able to grow better than wt plants in media with high Cu, Cd, and Zn concentrations.  
Altogether, our result s confirm the promising potential of these plant metallothioneins 
as heavy metal chelating agents. Different biotechnological approaches may be 
implemented to take advantage of their useful properties in bioremediation strategies.

concentración en los efluentes debe ser reducida previo a su vertido al ambiente. Se 
estima que los sistemas convencionales de depuración de aguas residuales sólo logran 
eliminar el 20% del nitrógeno inicial. Por lo tanto, para eliminar el nitrógeno remanente, 
se utilizan distintos procesos denominados tratamiento terciario, en el cual participan 
principalmente las bacterias nitrificantes y des nitrificantes. Estas bacterias logran 
convertir el amonio a nitrato y luego a nitrógeno gaseoso mediante lo que se conoce 
como el ciclo del nitrógeno. Conocer la diversidad y dinámica de estas poblaciones 
brinda herramientas para lograr un sistema de trata miento eficiente.

del ciclo del nitrógeno en los dos reactores, una laguna de ecualización y aireación

forman part e de un sistema de tratamiento de efluentes de una industria vitivinícola y se 
analizaron tanto en época de vendimia como de intervendimia. Se estudió la estructura, 
dinámica y diversidad de las bacterias nitrificantes, desnitrificantes y fijadoras de 
nitrógeno, mediante la técnica molecular Terminal Restriction Fragment Length 
Polymorphism (T-RFLP).

de nitrito (NOB, Nitrobacter y Nitrospira), bacterias desnitrificant es y 
bacterias fijadoras de nitrógeno en época de vendimia e intervendimia. Sin embargo, la 
estructura de la comunidad cambia, y claramente la modificación en el efluente produce 
un cambio en los microorganismos involucrados en el ciclo del nitrógeno. Las AOB solo 
fueron detectadas en dos muestras mientras que las NOB fueron detectadas en la 
totalidad de las muestras tomadas de ambos reactores, con dinámicas que variaron 
según el género estudiado. Por otro lado, la comunidad desnitrificante, también 
abundan te, se mostró relativamente estable en época de intervendimia, con una 
marcada variación al llegar la vendimia.  
     A pesar de que los reactores estudiados no están específicamente diseñados para la 
remoción de nitrógeno, la presencia de organismos nitrif icantes y desnitrificantes parece 
indicar el funcionamiento del ciclo de nitrógeno en los mismos.

C-acetato y N -nitrato cercanas al 90% y rendimientos de formación de HCO 3- y N 2 de 0.8. Con 
los lodos estabilizados se determinó el comportamiento cinético y fisiológico de la 
desnitrificación utilizando diferentes concentraciones de C -acetato o C -AMP (20, 40,  60, 80, 100

filling the spraying equipment, a typical on -farm point source contamination. A 
biopurification system based on the adsorption and degradation capacity of an organic 
biomixture covered with a grass layer was evaluated to degrade a mixture of atrazine

solution containing a mixture of formulated ATZ, CHL and IPR (35 mg of each a.i. kg-1) 
was sprayed ove r the surface of the containers three times (0, 30 and 60 days). The 
concentration of the pesticides and their main metabolites were measured in lixiviates as 
well as in the biomixture during 90 days, biological activities (urease, phenoloxidase and

evaluated in the biomixture during the assay.

vegetal cover.  In planted containers, atrazine and iprodione deg radation was >90%

detected in biomixture. On the other hand, approximately of 91%, 80% and 73% of the 
chlorpyrifos was degraded after the first, second and third pesticide applic ations, 
respectively. The main metabolite of chlorpyrifos 3,5,6 -trichloropyridinol (TCP) was 
detected in biomixture especially at day 20 of the assay in unplanted container. Besides, 
the vegetal cover collaborated with retention of pesticides being only hy droxiatrazine 
(HA) detected in lixiviates. Biological activities were not affected by the application of 
pesticides, showing some differences between planted and non -planted containers. High 
similarity between microbial groups (actinobacterias, bacteria an d fungi) was observed, 
being not affected by reapplications of pesticides.   The numbers of copies of bacteria 
and actinobacterias remain almost constant during the assay. However, the number of 
copies of fungi was significantly higher in unplanted contain er without contamination.

anaerobic systems (UASB, EGSB & IC reactors) applied worldwide for wastewater 
treatment. Despite of decades of studies of the biomass granulation process, it is still not 
fully understood and controlled. “Degranulation/lack of granulation” is a problem that 
occurs sometimes in anaerobic systems resulting usually in heavy loss of biom ass and 
poor treatment efficiencies or even complete reactor failure. Such a problem occurred in 
Mexico in two full -scale UASB reactors treating cheese wastewater. A close follow up of 
the plant was performed to identify the factors responsible for the phe nomenon. 
Basically the list of possible causes to a granulation problem that were investigated can 
be classified among nutritional, i.e related to wastewater composition (e.g. deficiency or 
excess of macro - or micronutrients, too high COD proportion due to  proteins or volatile 
fatty acids, high ammonium, sulphate or fat concentrations, presence of toxicants), 
operational (excessive loading rate, sub or over -optimal water upflow velocity) and 
structural (poor hydraulic design of the plant). Based on literatu re results, an attempt to 
artificially granulate the reactor biomass through the addition of a cationic polymer was 
also tested.  
Despite of the large amount of parameters investigated, the nutritional or non -
nutritional causes of the granulation problem in volved in the present case could not be 
identified, even though the role of the residual milk fat not retained in the primary 
treatment step could not be completely discarded. Polymer dosage did not promote 
granulation contrary to what was expected. At the  opposite, it caused sludge flotation 
demonstrating that despite excellent results regularly reported in the literature for lab 
scale systems, it is premature to advise its use at real scale in running reactors unless 
its effectiveness and conditions of ap plication at such a scale can be established. By the 
end, for the cheese wastewater treatment plant under study, the lack of granulation 
turned out not to be important anymore. Actually, thanks to a structural remodelling of 
the reactors, their solid reten tion time became higher than 100 days indicating an 
excellent retention of the flocculent biomass, which was associated to high COD 
removal showing that the plant could finally operate properly in absence of a granulated 
biomass. While the causes of the gr anulation problems could not be identified, the 
present work remains an example of the strategy that must be followed to identify them 
and could be used as a guide for plant operators or consultants who are confronted with 
a similar situation independently  of the type of wastewater.

síntesis de pigmentos, entre otras. En medio acuoso el cromo puede encontrarse en 
dos estados de valencia, hexavalente (Cr(VI)) y/o trival ente (Cr(III)). Entre estas dos 
especies, las de cromo hexavalente poseen mayor solubilidad y movilidad en  
ambientes acuosos junto a la capacidad de atravesar membranas celulares. Así, el 
cromo hexavalente está definido como una especie con valores de bio toxicidad 
notablemente mayores que se su par trivalente.

matrices acuosas, una amplia variedad de sólidos han sido propuestos como eficaces 
adsorbentes. Estos materiales han conseguido separar el Cr(VI) de la fase acuosa a 
través de interacciones superficiales, y algunos de ellos, como los carbones dopados 
con nitrógeno, sólidos de origen biológico como las algas y algunas arcillas minerales,

forma de Cr 2O72-, CrO 4- o HCrO 4-, y continúa con la reducción hacia la especie trivalente 
menos tóxica. Estos sólidos, con capacidad de adsorción -reducción, presentan una 
enorme ventaja frente a aquellos que solo adsorben Cr(VI), ya que dan lugar a procesos 
de remediación más efectivos.

ordenadas (OMS) amino -funcionalizadas. Además, se analiza la relación entre el 
tamaño de partícula del adsorbente OMS y su capacidad para la remoción del metal.

poro (2.5 nm) y superficie específica (BET), pero diferente diámetro medio de partícula.

síntesis con aminopropiltrietoxisilano en tolueno. Los híbridos orgánicos/inorgánicos

escaneo y transmisión electrónica (SEM, TEM). Los materiales mesoporosos 
sintetizados presentaron altas capacidades para la eliminación de Cr(VI) a través de un 
mecanismo mixto de adsorción y reducción, no reportado hasta ahora para este tipo de 
materiales. Además, los resultados hallados demuestran que el tamaño de partícula es 
un parámetro fundamental que debe ser tenido en cuenta, junto con la superficie 
específica del sólido, a la hora de d esarrollar adsorbentes con altas capacidades de

poblacional, la eliminación de NH 4+ y 2-CP, utilizando dos lodos nitrificant es y dos 
reactores de lotes secuenciados (SBR). El SBR1 fue inoculado con un lodo expuesto 
previamente a 2 -CP, mientras que el SBR2 se inoculó con un lodo expuesto 
previamente a p-cresol. Se realizaron 7 ciclos con una duración de 30 días cada uno en 
prese ncia de diferentes concentraciones de 2 -clorofenol (mg C -2-CP/l): dos ciclos con

casos resultó inhibido por la adición de 2 -CP, pues las velocidades específicas de 
consumo de amonio y producción de nitrato disminuyeron de acuerdo a un control sin el
