adicionar cada una de las diferentes concentracion es de 2 -CP, mientras que en el lodo 
del SBR2, la estructura poblacional solo cambió al adicionar 20 mg C -2-CP/l y 
posteriormente, se mantuvo estable independientemente del incremento a 40 y 60 mg 
C-2-CP/l. Ambos lodos eliminaron simultáneamente NH 4+ y hast a 60 mg C -2-CP/l. Con 
los lodos del SBR1, expuestos previamente al 2 -CP, el comportamiento pudo estar 
asociado con la aparición de cepas tolerantes al 2 -CP, a una mejora metabólica de las 
cepas participantes y a la diversidad poblacional encontrada, mientr as que en el caso 
de los lodos del SBR2, el comportamiento se podría atribuir a una mejora metabólica y 
cinética de los microorganismos presentes, más que a los cambios observados en su 
población microbiana.

Chikungunya fever, and Zika in Brazil, the c onsumption of paracetamol has increased, 
because this drug is recommended for the treatment of those diseases, and this 
suggests an increase of paracetamol releases to sewers and water bodies, in Brazil.

paracetamol in anaerobic conditions, by performing the Specific Methanogenic Activity 
Test (SMA).

and working volume of 508 mL. Each reactor was lo aded with 388 mL of a paracetamol 
solution (761 ± 6 mg L-1), as only carbon source, 102 mL of nutrient solution (201 g L-1) 
and 14 mL of anaerobic sludge (28 g L -1), sampled from an industrial WWTP.  
Three reactors were operated with paracetamol (test) and two reactors were operated 
without paracetamol (control). The control reactors were used just to check the cell 
matter decomposition by auto -oxidation. The COD was analysed twice a week and the 
methane production was measured daily. The test lasted 95 days . The initial average 
COD of the substrates inoculated in the test reactors were 1160 ± 96 mg O 2 L-1.

L-1) and only 16 ± 1% of initial COD was converted to methane (COD equal to 187 ± 72 
mg O 2/L), in the test reactors. Moreover, the values of methane production in test and 
control reactors were similar, and the contents of test reactors presented a colour 
change (reddish colour).

paracetamol was not equivalent to the production of methane, and the produced 
methane in both reactors may be due to microbial auto -oxidation. With respect to the

substances (e. g. stearic acid, hypromellose, macrogol and povidone). These 
substances could have induced the paracetamol degradation to another degradat ion 
route, different from methanogenesis route.  In conclusion, paracetamol degradation has 
not occurred by the methanogenesis route and the organic matter mineralization present 
in the paracetamol is related to microbial auto -oxidation.

Wastewater treatment is an important part of environmen tal protection. The products 
of treatment of municipal wastewater are treated water and waste sludge. Optimum 
technological processes can ensure high level of wastewater treatment so the effluent 
can be discharged to surface water. However, disposal of was te sludge poses some 
problems. The proportion of organic substances in sludge reaches 40 -90% and thus this 
substrate could be used for manuring. However, it also contains important levels of 
heavy metals and is contaminated by bacteria, viruses and parasit ic stages. Thus its use 
for application to soil is limited. Only sludge which complies with the respective 
legislative requirements can be used for this purpose. This involves inevitably further 
treatment of municipal sludge including sanitization of this substrate to avoid hygiene 
risks. Various methods can be used for sanitization of sewage sludge. Advantageous is 
the use of natural materials such as calcium oxide or calcium hydroxide. These 
substances are effective in devitalization of potential pathogen s present in sludge, 
particularly by increasing pH, and have positive effects also after application of sludge to 
soil. After addition of calcium oxide to sludge, calcium hydroxide is produced at the 
release of heat. Addition of calcium oxide and natural z eolite increases the devitalisation 
effects. Zeolite also plays a positive role after application of amended sludge to soil. 
Besides showing a devitalisation effect on bacteria and viruses lime is effective also 
against eggs of parasites which accumulate i n the sludge in the process of treatment of 
municipal wastewaters.  
The study focused on monitoring and evaluation of relevant parameters in samples of 
sewage sludge obtained from municipal wastewater treatment plant.  Microbiological 
examination focused o n the groups of micro -organisms which indicate hygiene risk, 
particularly total coliforms, thermotolerant coliforms and faecal streptococci. In addition, 
the collected sewage sludge was sanitized by addition of lime and zeolite with the aim to 
achieve high  level of devitalisation of the monitored micro -organisms. Complete 
sanitization of raw municipal sludge have been achieved when using the following ratios 
in per cent: raw sludge: CaO : zeolite ─90 : 5 : 5. Chemical analyses proved that such a 
way stabili sed sludge could be used for production of industrial composts. Results of our 
examination showed that addition of lime and zeolite to sewage sludge was effective in 
devitalization of all monitored micro -organisms. After treatment with lime and zeolite no 
representatives of any of these groups could be recovered from the treated sludge. Thus 
the values limiting the application of sludge to soil were not exceeded. However, the 
quantity of sludge applied per hectare of agricultural soil must correspond to the  
requirement taking into consideration the content of heavy metals in this substrate.

La calidad del agua y su cantidad en niveles satisfactorios son unos de los mayores retos 
que enfrenta la mayoría de los países, en los días actuales. Según la O rganización de las 
Naciones Unidas (ONU), cerca del 70% de toda agua potable disponible en el mundo se 
utiliza para el riego, el 20% para las actividades industriales y el 10% para el uso hogareño. 
En el proceso de economía de agua potable, sobre todo en e l área de riego, el efluente de 
las Plantas de Tratamiento de Aguas Residuales (PTAR)  puede asumir un papel cada vez 
más importante, ya que presenta concentraciones significativas de macronutrientes tales 
como nitrógeno (N), fósforo (P) y potasio (K), esen ciales al adecuado desarrollo del cultivo 
de vegetales. Por otra parte, y en concentraciones más bajas, también se pueden encontrar 
en el efluente algunos metales como hierro (Fe), cobre (Cu) y zinc (Zn), también requeridos 
por las plantas, pero en pequeña s cantidades.  
El fríjol es un alimento de excelente valor nutritivo, cultivado principalmente en la 
producción de granos para el consumo humano.  Brasil es el mayor productor mundial de 
frijoles con producción anual promedia de 3,5 millones de toneladas y crecimiento anual del 
1,22%.  
 La Planta de Tratamiento de Aguas Residuales (PTAR) de este estudio presenta un 
sistema que comporta reactor UASB seguido de laguna de estabilización y filtros de piedra. 
El tiempo de retención hidráulica del sistema es de 10, 4 días, con flujo de 30 L/s. Este 
trabajo tuvo como objetivo evaluar los beneficios del uso del efluente de PTAR y lodo del 
UASB en la productividad y en la calidad nutricional de los granos de dos especies de fríjol: 
Phaseolus vulgaris  L. y Vigna unguicul ata. El experimento se montó en el diseño de 
bloques al azar en el sistema factorial 10 x 2, con tres repeticiones cada. Los tratamientos 
consistieron en: T0 (agua de abastecimiento), T1 (agua de abastecimiento + fertilizante 
NPK), T2 (agua de abastecimien to + inoculación por bacteria Rhizobium ), T3 (agua de 
abastecimiento + inoculación por Rhizobium  + fertilizante PK), T4 (efluente), T5 (efluente + 
inoculación por Rhizobium), T6 (efluente + inoculación por Rhizobium  + fertilizante PK), T7 
(lodo), T8 (lodo + inoculación por Rhizobium ) y T9 (lodo + inoculación por Rhizobium  + 
fertilizante PK). Las plantas fueron cultivadas en macetas conteniendo 10 kg de suelo, con 
riego monitoreado por peso.  
Los tratamientos con efluente y lodo presentaron rendimiento satisf actorio en cuanto a la 
productividad: 20% más alto que el tratamiento testigo, para ambas especies. En cuanto a 
la nutrición, el rendimiento fue todavía mayor: los granos fueron considerados 30% más 
nutritivos, en virtud de las concentraciones de Fe y Zn p rovenientes de estos materiales. 
Por lo tanto, el uso de aguas residuales tratadas y lodo en el cultivo de las especies de fríjol 
Phaseolus vulgaris  L. y Vigna unguiculata resultó factible .

Industrial liquid waste (ILW) from a pig slaughtering plant (PSP) can have a significant 
impact if discharged to a receiving water body without any treatment. ILWs as PSP are 
composed of organic matter, fats and oils, nitrogen, phosphorus and slaughterhouse 
wastewater (bloodwater) (mainly composed of iron), and could contaminate public sewers, 
groundwater, rivers and the sea1. 
Bioremediati on is an emerging waste management technique that uses living organisms 
(plants, algae, fungi, bacteria, etc.) to absorb, degrade, or transform pollutants and remove, 
inactivate (neutralize) or mitigate their effect on soil, water and air. In this research  
thraustochytrids  (TH) were used, which are a class of marine microorganisms belonging to 
the phylum Labyrinthulomycota found in various marine environments and estuaries, which 
have shown the ability to transform pollutants and trace metals in value -added  products 
(long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids: DHA and EPA)2. 
This work contemplates the use of ILW as substrate for culture (pH = 6.4), which was 
carried out in a 1L -fermentor, while batch cultivation was performed at 25°C, 180 rpm, for 7 
days, using a Chilean strain (VAL -B1) of the genus Thraustochytrium kinney . Initial 
physicochemical analysis of ILW was performed considering chemical oxygen demand 
(COD), fats and oils (F and O), total nitrogen, total phosphorus and total iron, according to 
the Chile an standards NCh2313/24 of. 97, NCh2313/6 of. 97, NCh2313/28 -2009, 
NCh2313/15 -2009 and NCh2313/10 of. 96, respectively.  
The results showed an initial COD of 9610 mg/L, 18625 mg/L for F and O, 1639 mg/L for 
total nitrogen, 149 mg/L for total phosphorus and 82.41 mg/L of total iron.  
On the fifth day of fermentation (batch cultivation), the culture was centrifuged in order to 
separate supernatant from biomass, and proceed with the respective analysis of 
supernatant. The COD of the medium supernatant was reduc ed by 56.29%, while F and O 
(highest parameter) had a significant decrease about 97%, and the content of total nitrogen, 
total phosphorus and total iron were also decreased by 63.27%, 97.55% and 40%, 
respectively.  
With these results, it was concluded that VAL-B1 can be used for the bioremediation of 
ILWs from PSPs, taking into account to the parameter values established by the Chilean 
standards for these industrial processes, which in this case have high values of degradation 
and mitigation, and thus TH are  a viable alternative for industrial wastewater treatment of 
this type of processing plants.

derivadas del proceso (polielectrolitos, surfactantes entre otras), que son potenciales 
ligandos de los metales presentes. La interacción “metal -ligando” cobra relevancia pues 
la forma qu ímica del metal puede condicionar el tipo de tecnología a aplicar para el 
tratamiento de los efluentes. Las tierras de diatomeas (TD) son un adsorbente natural, 
de bajo costo, abundante en la Argentina. Nuestro objetivo es evaluar la capacidad de 
las TD de  retener el zinc presente en este tipo de efluentes.  
En un estudio previo1 se caracterizaron los baños de segundo enjuague de una 
industria galvanoplástica. Se determinó la presencia de Zn(II) y Pb(II), siendo Zn (II) el 
componente mayoritario, y de dos fa milias de ligandos de Zn de fuerza moderada en 
concentración milimolar. También se estableció que las TD son capaces de retener 
Zn(II), con lo que surge la pregunta ¿la presencia de ligandos orgánicos en un efluente 
afectará la retención del metal? En el p resente trabajo se estudia la interacción entre las 
TD y ligandos modelo (L) moderados y fuertes (HIDA y EDTA, respectivamente).  
Se evaluó la retención de Zn (II) por las TD en contacto con soluciones equimolares 
de Zn y L. Por otro lado, se modificaron la s TD por exposición a soluciones de estos 
ligandos. Los sólidos obtenidos (TD -HIDA y TD -EDTA) se caracterizaron por difracción 
de rayos X y potencial zeta2.  Se obtuvieron las isotermas de adsorción de estos nuevos 
sólidos y se evaluó su retención de Zn (I I). Las concentraciones de Zn(II) se midieron 
por voltamperometría de preconcentración electrolítica (VPE).  
Se pudo determinar que el porcentaje de retención de Zn (II) por parte de las TD 
disminuyó de 68%2 a 16% y 4.5% cuando las soluciones con el metal contienen 
además los ligandos HIDA y EDTA, respectivamente. En cambio, usando los sólidos 
modificados con los ligandos como adsorbente (TD -HIDA, TD -EDTA), el porcentaje de 
retención Zn aumentó a 88.9 % y 86.1%, respectivamente. Estos resultados muestran 
que la presencia de ligandos afecta la retención del metal por las TD, dependiendo que 
éstos se encuentren formando complejos con el metal en solución o que se presenten 
unidos al adsorbente.

The discharge of untreated wastewater containing high amount of organic matter and 
nutrients such as phosphorus and nitrogen into waterways leads to a decrease in 
dissolved oxygen a nd an increase in eutrophication. Some specific operational 
conditions are necessary in order to successfully obtain high biological nutrient removal. 
Sequencing batch reactor (SBR) where reactions occur in stages can promote both 
nitrogen and phosphorus r emoval. For instance, in the case of using enhanced 
biological phosphorus removal (EBPR) process microbes are exposed to cyclical 
anaerobic, aerobic and/or anoxic conditions. A selective advantage is provided by the 
polyphosphate accumulating organisms (PA Os) because they can store volatile fatty 
acids (VFAs) as polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHAs) inside the cells on the anaerobic stage.

involved in EBPR process such as the genus Can didatus Accumulibacter phosphatis, 
known as the principal agent.  In the case of nitrogen removal, the pathways are by 
nitrification -denitrification, in which nitrifying microorganisms oxidize ammonia to nitrate 
aerobically and denitrifying reduce nitrate t o nitrogen gas in anoxic medium. Molecular 
biological techniques can assist the microorganisms identification in sludges, and an 
useful technique is the Polimerase Chain Reaction (PCR).

kg COD.m-3.d-1) and cycles of 8 hours, being operated with 2 -h, 4-h, 1,25 -h and 0,75 -h 
period under anaerobic, aerobic, anoxic, sedimentation and emptying, respectively. 
During the aerobic period, one reactor was continuously aerated, while t he other one on  
intermittently. Along the 230 -d operational period, nitrogen and phosphorus removal 
were monitored through the influent and effluent analysis.  Batching time profiles were 
carried out in order to observe the production and consumption of PH As, as well as the 
metabolic pathways. Mixed liquor samples were collected to identify microorganisms by 
PCR using primers specific for Nitrosomonas , Nitrospira , denitrifiers and Accumulibacter 
phosphatis .In both reactors the EBPR process was satisfactory reaching total 
phosphorus concentration below 1 mg L-1. PHAs production and consumption occurred 
as expected. The reactor with intermittent aeration showed a faster biomass growth than 
the continuously aerated reactor. Nitrification and denitrification wer e more efficient in 
continuously aerated reactor.

previous industrial surfactant was used. The LAS is highly biodegradable under aerobic 
conditions, but there is still some questions for its removal when anaerobic reactors are 
used. In Brazil and many countries, anaerobi c reactors have been frequently used in 
sewage treatment plants (STP). However, the LAS removal when treating domestic 
sewage in that reactor can be influenced by many factors involving the influent 
characteristics and reactor operation conditions. Two of the factors were studied in a 
32.7L UASB reactor under controlled conditions (pH 8 and HRT 12 h). The effect of oil 
concentration (0 and 0.25 mg.L-1) and previous oxygenation (with and without) of the 
influent domestic sewage was evaluated. A 2k factorial design was used to analyze the 
effect and interactions of both factors, resulting in 4 phases with a 40day period each.

and 3 to 7 mg.L-1, respectively. The results showed  that increasing the oil concentration 
alone, the adsorption increased by 19%; and with previous oxygenation alone, the 
increase was 19%. Under the same experimental conditions, the biodegradation 
decreased by 7 % and 9%, respectively. The effects on adsor ption and biodegradation 
were different when there was interaction between both factors. Without LAS 
oxygenation but increasing oil concentration from 0 to 0.25 mg.L-1, there was no change 
in adsorption and biodegradation removal. However, with previous ox ygenation and 
increasing the oil concentration, there was a 38% increase in the adsorption and a 13% 
decrease in biodegradation. The highest biodegradation of 15% was achieved when 
there was no LAS adsorption and when some desorption was observed. This occ urred

added; the second, when there was no oxygenation but 0.25 mg oil.L-1 was added. In 
this study, the fact that the LAS highest biodegradation was lower than that obt ained in 
other works can also be attributed to the much lower concentration in the influent. The 
adsorption enhanced when the biodegradation was inhibited. The highest adsorption of 
37% was achieved when there was no biodegradation. Therefore, LAS adsorpti on 
inhibited biodegradation under anaerobic conditions, and the oil influence occurred only 
when there was previous influent oxygenation.

material to obtain nuclear fuels. For this reason, the effluent of this process contains 
high concentration of ammonium (4g/l N -NH 4+) and uranium. Therefore, these effluents 
must  be treated to diminish the concen trations of NH 4 and U (300ppm UO 2+2) in order to 
fulfill local environmental laws. Ammonium is a very soluble ion and it is difficult to 
precipitate. Uranium has variable speciation and it´s fate is related to the leaching and 
subsequent precipitating cond itions.  
In this work, we studied and applied a nitrification process using an autotrophic 
bacterial consortium obtained from a polluted stream  to oxidize the ammonium to nitrate. 
Due to the long time needed to generate the appropriate amount of biomass, th e key 
point in this process is the bacterial cells immobilization to a solid support, to avoid 
biomass loss and also to enhance the performance in kinetic and effectiveness terms. 
Hence, we worked with previously developed copolymeric hydrogels, which were  
obtained by gamma irradiation of 2 -hydroxyethyl methacrylate.

with an ammonium concentration reduction of 90% (initial value: 4000ppm). The kinetic 
rate of consumption  was 350mg/l.day. The treatment was also evaluated in terms of 
external parameters (oxygen consumption rate (rO 2) and CO 3-2 consumption), which are 
stoichiometric reactants in the nitrification process. The hydrogels were studied by 
scanning electron micro scopy after the process. Due to its elastic characteristics, this 
material was no deformed during experiments. The development of anaerobic internal 
zones was avoided. The obtained results showed the feasibility of the proposed 
methodology for the treatmen t of effluents from nuclear industry. The uranyl ions at the 
end of process were not detected.

décadas y para removerlos de efluentes, además de los tratamientos fisicoquímicos 
tradicionales, la biorremediació n es una opción cada vez más usada. Hay bacterias 
propias de los sistemas contaminados que pueden tolerar altas concentraciones de 
metales pesados y que además tienen actividad sulfato reductora. El metabolismo de 
estas bacterias genera consumo de acidez y  producción de sulfuros. En consecuencia, 
los sedimentos se alcalinizan y una gran cantidad de metales precipitan como sulfuros o 
hidróxidos metálicos y resultan asociados o adsorbidos en ellos. Así los sedimentos 
actúan como sumidero de metales pesados.

del área metropolitana de Buenos Aires. El alto contenido de materia orgánica 
procedente de los efluentes genera características anaeróbicas en los sedimentos, en 
donde la oxidación de materia orgánica es catalizada principalmente por bacterias 
reductoras de sulfato (BRS) y de hierro.  
El objetivo de este trabajo es estudiar la capacidad de precipita r metales de bacterias 
aisladas de sedimentos anaeróbicos del río Reconquista, para lo cual se realizó la 
caracterización cinética del crecimiento y de la actividad reductora de sulfato en 
sistemas de frascos y por respirometría. La caracterización se hizo  en  medio Posgate 
C y luego con el agregado de distintas concentraciones de metales con diferentes 
características de solubilidad y de afinidad por materia orgánica (Cu, Zn y Ni).

Many pharmaceutical compounds are incompletely removed by conventional 
processes in wastewater treatment plants, and they are released into natural waters. 
These compounds are suspected to cause toxic effects on living  organisms even at very 
low concentrations. Because of their continuous input and accumulation in the 
environment, they are considered as persistent micropollutants. Particularly, clofibric 
acid (CA), the active metabolite of the lipid regulator clofibrate , is hardly biodegradable 
and it has been detected in surface waters. Chemical oxidation by photocatalysis can be 
employed as a pre -treatment step to enhance the biodegradability of wastewaters 
containing CA, which could then be treated by a biological pro cess with lower costs. This 
study focuses on the degradation of CA by using a combined treatment of immobilized 
TiO 2 photocatalysis and biological oxidation.  
Photocatalytic experiments were carried out in a fixed -bed reactor filled with TiO 2-
coated glass r ings. The reactor was cylindrical with two flat, borosilicate glass windows. 
It operates in a closed recirculating circuit driven by a peristaltic pump . Illumination was 
provided by two sets of four black light UV lamps, placed on both sides of the reactor . 
The catalyst (TiO 2 P25 from Evonik) was immobilized on the glass rings (5 mm x 5 mm) 
by the dip -coating technique. Experiments were carried out employing rings with 1, 2 
and 3 catalyst coatings, and different levels of irradiation (100%, 62%, and 30%). E ach 
run lasted 6 hours. Along the treatment, the concentration of CA and its main 
intermediate, 4 -chlorophenol (4 -CP), were measured by HPLC. The biodegradability of 
the samples collected at different stages of the photocatalytic process was evaluated by 
means of the ratio BOD 5/COD (5 -days biochemical oxygen demand/chemical oxygen 
demand). Biological oxidation was carried out in a laboratory -scale reactor operated in a 
batch mode. This reactor was mounted on an orbital shaker and it was inoculated with 
freeze dried bacteria, taken from a commercial consortium called Bi -Chem SM 700 of 
Sybrom Chemical. Along the biological treatment, the toxicity of the samples and the 
concentration of 4 -CP were assessed. Toxicity was evaluated by means of the Microtox® 
acute toxicity test.   
The highest degradation rate of CA in the photocatalytic reactor was obtained with 
rings with 3 catalyst coatings and 100 % irradiation level. After 6 h of treatment, CA was 
fully degraded, but the main intermediate 4 -CP still remained in t he solution. The 
BOD 5/COD ratio of the sample was enhanced from 0.2 to 0.7, indicating that this effluent 
could be subjected to a consecutive biological treatment. After 7 days of biological 
oxidation, the complete removal of 4 -CP was achieved, and the tox icity of the sample 
was significantly reduced, as evidenced in the decrease from 75% to 22% of the 
inhibition of the bioluminescence of Vibrio fischeri (Microtox® test).

Wastewater treatment is an environmental issue of great concern for industrial sector. 
Industrial processes such as galvanic treatment, production and use of fertilizers, textiles 
products fabrication, refineries a nd pulp and paper industries deal with the wastewater 
treatment polluted with heavy metals (Cu, Zn, Cr, Cd, Ni, among others) or dyes. This 
kind of pollution is dangerous not only to human health but also to the environment, 
because they accumulate in the trophic chain causing damage to the aquatic organisms 
and reaching also the humans. To eliminate these contaminants usually are used 
physicochemical process such as membrane filtration, reverse osmosis, ionic exchange, 
chemical precipitation, evaporation, etc, besides aerobic and anaerobic biological 
treatments. However, these operations present several disadvantages such as high 
operational costs, low efficiencies (especially at low concentration of contaminants), and 
high amount of sludge generation. One of the techniques most used to this purpose is 
the adsorption onto activated carbon, which have demonstrated to be effective at low 
contaminant concentrations in the range of 1 to 100 mg/L. However, the relatively high 
cost of this material limits its use in small and medium industries. For this reason, the 
present work explores novel materials for its use as adsorbents for contaminants 
removal in aqueous solution. Several materials were used to prepare activated carbons 
(AC) such as agricultural residues ( sugarcane bagasse and palm oil empty fruit bunch), 
and industrial residues such as scrap tyres. Also agricultural residues were tested as 
biosorbents, like the palm oil empty fruit bunch and palm kernel cake (without any 
modification or processing) to eval uate its adsorption capacity.  
The adsorption capacity of the materials was tested at laboratory scale in batch 
experiments, using methylene blue (MB) and rhodamine B as dyes, Cu(II) as heavy 
metal, and phenol as model pollutants in aqueous solution.  
In ge neral the results showed that the activated carbons obtained from sugarcane 
bagasse and palm oil empty fruit bunch (by chemical activation with phosphoric acid in 
one step) reached the best adsorption capacity (733 and 500 mg MB/g AC), while AC 
produced fr om scrap tyres by the same method reached 388,65 mg MB/g AC (by direct 
activation method), and 175,83 mg MB/g AC (by pyrolysis + activation method). For 
comparison, biosorbents such the palm oil empty fruit bunch and palm kernel cake 
adsorbed 27,25 and 29, 78 mg MB/g adsorbent, respectively. These results showed that 
original agricultural residues without any modification presented some adsorption 
capacity, but the activation step allowed the increase in the surface area and 
consequently in the adsorption ca pacity of these materials until reaching adsorption 
capacity values almost 18 times higher.  
 
Keywords : wastewater treatment, heavy metals, adsorption, dyes .

In this work, we made use of the sol -gel method to synthesize TiO 2 nanoparti cle 
powders with different mass ratios between crystal phases and different morphologies. 
These characteristics were controlled through the synthesis parameters and the 
calcination temperature. By this procedure we want to compare the obtained catalysts 
and try to identify the characteristics that are of most relevance for the photocatalysis 
reaction.  
The obtained powders were characterized by means of x -ray diffraction (XRD), 
scanning electron microscopy (SEM), and the BET method for specific surface area 
determination. With these measurements we corroborated that we can effectively control 
the catalysts properties: we obtained pure anatase or rutile powders, and we also 
obtained samples with anatase/rutile percentages of 80/20 or 40/60, to give some 
exampl es. We also have powders with particle sizes ranging from 15 to 100 nm and 
surface areas varying from 20 to 90 m2/g. 
We performed photocatalytic experiments using a slurry reactor with formic acid as a 
test contaminant. In this case we achieved, for some p owders, degradation rates similar 
to those corresponding to the commercial catalyst Aeroxide TiO 2 P25. 
With the results of the photocatalytic experiments we determined the photonic 
efficiencies of our photocatalysts, ranging from 6% to 55%, while we obtain ed a value of 
67% for P25 in the same reactor conditions.  
Finally, we measured the relevant optical properties (absorbance, diffuse reflectance, 
and diffuse transmittance) of our synthesized samples. These properties were used in a 
Monte Carlo model to sol ve the radiative transference equation (RTE) and to obtain the 
quantum efficiency. Once again, we obtained a wide range of values, from 0.05% to 
0.42%, being the best close to the one from P25 (0.51%).  
So far we have obtained satisfactory results. This wor k is still ongoing and we are 
planning to synthesize new catalysts to further correlate our efficiency results with the 
synthesis parameters.

persists in Brazil. In northeastern of Brazil , the consequences of this practice are 
intensified due to long periods of drought, low rainfall and, sometimes, intermittent river 
regimen that reduce the auto depuration capacity. Caruaru city in Pernambuco state 
centralizes an important textile pole, sp ecialized in jeans washing (laundries). Some 
laundries in the region release their effluents in the crossing rivers without proper 
treatment. Surfactants in textile effluents are versatile due to the ability of interacting and 
reacting with different types  of molecules. The linear alkylbenzene sulfonate (LAS) is a 
widely used synthetic anionic surfactant, to produce cleaning agents such as soaps and 
detergents. High concentrations of LAS in water bodies can cause significant 
environmental, social and econom ic problems, although its known aerobic 
biodegradability.  
In this work, the LAS concentration was analyzed in different sections of the Ipojuca 
river and in the textile effluents, and it was measured as total anionic surfactant (TAS). 
Samples from six jean s laundries effluents were monthly collected and analyzed, 
between July and September of 2014. The sampling of Ipojuca river water was 
performed in the five points: two in rural area, one before and one after the river reach 
Caruaru city (named P1 and P5) and three points in the city urban area (named P2, P3, 
P4) where the laundries are located. The water river samples were monthly collected, 
from October of 2014 to October of 2015.  
Independently of the laundry size, similar TAS concentration was detected, around 
1.7 ± 0.5 mg MBAS.L-1 in samples from laundries effluents. The TAS concentration in 
laundries effluents was lower than the found in the average in water from the river 
(around 5 ± 2 mg MBAS.L-1). This finding indicates that possibly domestic sewage may 
also have contributed to the found TAS concentration in the river. The lowest TAS 
concentration was 1.3 ± 0.7 mg MBAS.L-1 and 2 ± 1 mg MBAS.L in P1 (rural area) and 
P2 (industrial center) sampling points, respectively. In P3 and P4, both in the urban 
center, the highest concentrations were found, 5 ± 3 mg MBAS.L-1 and 4 ± 2 mg 
MBAS.L-1, respectively. Finally, in point P5, the TAS concentration decreased again to 2 
± 2 mg MBAS.L-1, showing the Ipojuca river ability in partially depurating the pollution 
discharges.  Considering this parameter, we noted that, in terms of LAS concentration in 
the Ipojuca river, domestic sewage may have contributed more than textile wastewater. 
Besides that, the concentration decreased when leaving the urban center showing the  
auto depuration river ability.

(Argentina)  
 
M. Bargiela* , A. F. de  Iorio  
Cátedra de Química Analítica. Depto de Recursos Naturales y Ambiente.  Facultad de Agronomía. 
Universidad de Buenos Aires.  Avda San Martín 4453. CABA,  Argentina.  
 
Los estudios sistemáticos de las estructuras d e las sustancias húmicas son el primer 
paso hacia la comprensión de su interacción con otros elementos y compuestos. Las 
características moleculares que influyen en la capacidad que tienen estas sustancias para 
formar complejos son la polifuncionalidad, su  carácter polielectrolítico, la presencia de sitios 
hidrofóbicos e hidrofílicos en sus moléculas y la facultad de formar asociaciones 
intermoleculares que cambian la conformación molecular. Entender las propiedades ácido -
base de los ácidos húmicos y fúlvic os y de la materia orgánica en aguas y sedimentos es 
un prerrequisito para comprender y modelar las reacciones de unión a los metales en 
sistemas acuáticos.  Se estudiaron el contenido de carbono, las propiedades características 
de los espectros IR., y el c ontenido de grupos funcionales a través de valoraciones ácido -
base, en cada fracción de las sustancias húmicas de sedimentos del cauce de la cuenca 
Matanza Riachuelo con diferentes usos de la tierra.  Se estimó el contenido de Corg de los 
sedimentos por el método de Walkley y Black, y se determinó N Kjeldahl para calcular la 
relación C/N en cada sitio. Las sustancias húmicas se obtuvieron según procedimientos 
convencionales. Se determinó C en ácidos fúlvicos y húmicos, y se observaron las 
características de los espectros IR de las fracciones. Para la caracterización de los tipos de 
grupos funcionales a partir del estudio de sus propiedades ácido -base, se realizaron 
valoraciones potenciométricas a través del modelo adaptado por Naja et al.1. Según las 
relacion es C/N se observaron orígenes diferentes de la materia orgánica sedimentaria, 
fundamentalmente autóctona (algogénica) en la cuenca alta; y una mezcla con materia 
orgánica depositada de la escorrentía en la cuenca media. En los lugares altamente 
contaminado s de la cuenca baja las relaciones C/N resultan explicables por un alto 
contenido de proteínas asociadas a las sustancias húmicas.  El estudio de los espectros IR 
mostró la relación de la materia orgánica con los metales. Los ácidos fúlvicos presentaron 
sitios de unión sin ocupar debido al elevado contenido de grupos funcionales. La mayor 
saturación de uniones complejantes en los ácidos húmicos, se debe a la menor proporción 
de grupos funcionales presentes en esta fracción. Se observaron en los ácidos húmico s 
características alifáticas propias de zonas contaminadas. La presencia de grupos proteicos 
encapsulados en las fracciones orgánicas de los sitios de la cuenca baja está relacionada 
con compuestos procedentes de actividades antrópicas.  Las características  ácido base 
mostraron especies ácidas fuertes y débiles que representan a grupos carboxilo. Se apreció 
heterogeneidad de los grupos funcionales en los sitios afectados por actividades antrópicas. 
La relación porcentual de grupos fenilo concuerda con el ori gen de la materia orgánica. Las 
constantes de acidez reflejaron el origen fitoplanctónico en la cuenca alta del cauce 
principal y la presencia de compuestos biogénicos  en la zona del Riachuelo.  
 
Palabras clave : Sustancias húmicas, sedimentos, ríos

El triclosan (TCS) y el triclocarban (TCB) son contaminantes emergentes que tienen 
como destino final las aguas residuales urbanas e industriales, pudiendo ser 
degradados y eliminados durante el tratamiento EDAR, aunque se ha demostr ado que 
estos métodos no son efectivos; se utilizan como agente antimicrobiano en 
desodorantes, jabones, cremas y, especialmente, en  productos de higiene dental 
además es antiséptico empleado en productos hospitalarios1. Se demostró que pueden 
actuar como disruptores endocrinos en animales lo cual hace sospechar que podría 
tener el mismo efecto en los seres humanos2. Este trabajo se realizó un estudio 
cinético, biodegradación en suelo y compost proveniente de lodos de depuradora y 
mezcla de ambas matrices. Se utilizó la técnica de extracción por ultrasonido (USE) 
para separar los analitos de la matrices involucradas  y fueron detectados y cuantificado 
mediante Cromatografía de Líquidos de Ultra Presión (UPLC) acoplada a 
Espectrometría de Masas en Tandem (MS/M S, QqQ). Se determinó la cinética de 
evolución que siguen estos compuestos. El tratamiento consistió en añadir los 
contaminantes de forma manual y regar las parcelas con agua de pozo. Se fijaron dos 
condiciones diferentes Parcela 1 (P1) suelo con los conta minantes puros aplicados 
directamente al suelo, Parcela 2 (P2) suelo emendadas con compost y contaminada 
con TCS y TCB. Se evaluó la cinética de degradación de la P1 y P2 a profundidades (2, 
10, 20, 30, 60 cm) a lo largo del tiempo (0, 15 y 30 días), se ob servó que se ajustaron a 
una cinética exponencial de primer orden (C=Co·e-k.t). En la P1 el TCS era retenido y 
degradado en la superficie (2 cm) con un tiempo de vida media (t 1/2) 214.6 h, mientras 
que el TCB se detecta en los primeros 50 cm. En la P2 el T CS también desaparece por 
completo en esta zona con un (t 1/2) de 146.5 h y al igual que en la P2 el TCB lixivia 
hasta los 50. Como conclusión general, se observa que los tiempos de vida media son 
mayores en las condiciones experimentales de la parcela P1. Esto pudo deberse a que 
al enmendar el suelo agrícola con compost, se aportó materia orgánica, hecho que 
favoreció el crecimiento de microorganismos provocando un aumento en la 
biodegradación de los componentes estudiados.

Contamination of aquatic sediments is a major concern worldwide. In reference to 
metals, aquatic organisms can take up metals through multiple pathways, with possible 
chronic and acute adverse effects.  
The Pilcomayo River (South America) is unique for its features. It presents a marked 
interseasonal variability in water  discharge and is also one of the rivers with highest 
suspended solids transportation in the world. With its headwaters in the Bolivian Andes, 
Pilcomayo River tributaries have been historically impacted by wastewater discharges 
from the mining district in the Cerro Rico de Potosí. In the last 20 years some tailing 
dams have colapsed releasing thousands of kilograms of wastes. During the rainy 
season,  these wastes reach the tributaries and ultimately Pilcomayo River, potentially 
threatening the lower basin floodplains and wetlands where solids are naturally 
deposited. To determine the environmental impact of these releases, it is important to 
predict the partitioning of metals to suspended particulate matter, speciation and its fate 
to establish potencial sh ort and long -term hazards to aquatic life.   
Batch experiments were carried out to study the sorption kinetics of zinc (main metal 
extracted) onto natural suspended solids in Pilcomayo River surface water (collected in 
Misión La Paz, Salta). Zinc dissolved  and total concentrations in Pilcomayo River 
surface water were 0.05±0.01 and 3.60±0.03 mg/L, respectively. Suspended solids 
concentration yielded 55.1±3.41 gr/L. Experimental containers with 250 ml of Pilcomayo 
River water were spicked to reach a 1 mg/L n ominal zinc concentration, sealed and 
placed on a rotating rack that provided (800rpm) end -over-end mixing.  Samples were 
taken at 5 , 15, 30, 60, 360 (6 h) and 1440 (24 h) minutes  from the control and treatment 
groups in triplicate and the dissolved and tot al concentrations of zinc were determined. 
Under constant ambient temperature and pH condictions, batch experiments results 
showed that 100 % of the added zinc was sorbed to suspended solids within the first 5 
minutes. No significant modifications were obs erved in the dissolved and total zinc 
concentrations in subsequent time extractions. Grain size analysis of sediments showed 
100 % silt and clay sizes. These results reflect the important role of the very high load of 
suspended solids in determining zinc p artitioning in Pilcomayo River waters. However, 
further research is needed in order to determine metal speciation in the sediments and 
their possible mobility under dynamic redox conditions, since the floodplains are 
subjected to flood and drought during t he summer and winter seasons, respectively.

general contienen bajas concentraciones del contaminante (sustancias altamente 
tóxicas), junto con altas concentraciones de materia orgánica natural (MON) que puede 
actuar como scavenger . Los radicales reactivos generados en la superficie de TiO 2 rara

reacción deseada, los contaminantes deben estar disponibles en la superficie de TiO 2.

eficiencia y la especificidad del proceso fotocatalítico. Para ello, se utilizaron

La industria yerbatera genera diversos subproductos no aptos para consumo humano 
(polvo y palos). El polvo contiene un 90 % de materia orgánica y al menos ocho 
minerales esenciales para los cultivos, siendo los que se encuentran en forma 
mayoritaria: calcio, magnesio y potasio. Este sistema constituye una fuente excepcional 
de nutrientes para el suelo dedicado a la agricultura. En el presente  trabajo, se 
formularon  encapsulados de fertilizan tes con una elevada proporción de polvo de yerba 
mate (PYM) como componente principal de la matriz. El polvo de yerba mate (tamaño 
de partícula <710 µm) se mezcló con alginato de sodio (2% p/v) y urea en polvo (2%) 
como fertilizante modelo. Se estudiaron l as isotermas de sorción para formulaciones 
con diferente concentración de PYM: 25, 50 y 80 mg/mL alginato.  Los encapsulados 
fueron caracterizados mediante Calorimetría Diferencial de Barrido (DSC) y 
espectroscopia infrarroja (FTIR). Se determinó la resiste ncia de las cápsulas obtenidas 
(“Crushing Strength”) con un texturómetro y la absorción de agua (WA). Se observó que 
las muestras son estables en el rango de temperaturas de aplicación y almacenamiento. 
Mediante microscopía SEM -EDX se observaron matrices h omogéneas y se confirmó 
que la urea se distribuyó de manera uniforme en las zonas interna y externa de los 
encapsulados.  La resistencia de las cápsulas fue comparable con la de productos 
comerciales (urea granulada).  La concentración de polvo en las matric es tuvo un efecto 
significativo sobre la sorción de agua, disminuyendo la higroscopicidad a medida que 
aumentó la concentración de polvo. El porcentaje de encapsulación de la urea en todas 
las formulaciones fue cercano al 100%. Se estudió el efecto del agr egado de capas 
externas de diversos polímeros (quitosano, almidón, PVA) para retardar la liberación de 
urea en el suelo. Las cápsulas sin cubierta liberaron el total de la urea en 5 días. Las 
capas de polímeros ensayadas prolongaron el tiempo de liberación .  
Los resultados obtenidos indican que la encapsulación de fertilizantes con polvo de 
yerba mate constituye un ejemplo interesante de producto amigable con el 
medioambiente con amplias aplicaciones en el desarrollo de una agricultura 
sustentable.

Deteriorating air quality is easily perceived, especially in cities with a high in dustrial 
development. The Tula -Tepeji region, in Hidalgo State, Mexico, is a critical area due to 
the emission of 500 thousand tons/year air pollutants emitted by the industrial activity. 
The aim of this study was to determine the concentration of elements  associated with 
PM 10 and identify possible emissions sources in three municipalities of the Tula -Tepeji 
region: Atitalaquia, Atotonilco de Tula and Tepeji del Rio, during rainy (June -september) 
and dry (Octuber -december) season in 2007. PM 10 were collecte d using low volume 
equipment (Minivolt -Airmetrics). The content of the following elements Ca, Cl, Cr, Cu, 
Fe, K, Mn, Ni, Pb, S, Ti, V, Zn in PM10 was determined using PIXE method. PM 10 
contents in both season showed a similar dynamic in Atitalaquia and Ato tonilco de Tula, 
in which exceeded at least 6 and 13 times respectively, the maximum allowable limit of 
PM 10 according to NOM -025-SSA1 -1993. Calcium and Silice were the major elements in 
PM 10 (10142 ± 6160 and 2647 ± 1901 ngm-3, respectively) in Atitalaqui a and Atotonilco 
in both seasons. On the other hand, Calcium and Sulfur were the mayor elements in 
Tepeji del Río in both seasons ( 3228±1844 and 2790 ±1186). The rest of the elements 
ranged between 587 ±299 and  13 ngm-3. During the dry season (October to Dec ember) 
were observed increased concentrations of metals in Atitalaquia and Atotonilco de Tula.  
Factor analysis with Varimax rotation showed that the possible sources of emission of 
the elements studied were mainly burning coal and oil, soil dust, motor ve hicles, 
construction industry / cement and smelting iron Steel. Due a high concentration of the 
metals in particulate matter during both seasons, the air quality is poor and pollution by 
PM10 sometimes exceeds Mexican Air Quality Standards, which may be as sociated 
with incidence of respiratory illness and acute respiratory infections in this region.

Veterinary pharmaceuticals, present in animal wastewater, have been identified as 
important contaminants in the environment. Meanwhile, regional data about the 
occurrence and distribution of veterinary pharmaceutica ls in animal wastewater are still 
limited at present. Thus, it becomes necessary to investigate the occurrence of these 
bioactive compounds in animal wastewater, especially in developing countries where 
data of environmental occurrence are either scarce or  non-existent.  
This study develops a simple and sensitive liquid Chromatography -ultraviolet 
detection for the multi -class determination of five pharmaceuticals (enr ofloxacin, 
oxytetracycline, 17β - estradiol, salicylic acid, and sulfamethoxazole) in swine 
wastewater collected from the Western Cape Province, South Africa. Both liquid and 
solid (i.e. suspended solids) phases of the swine wastewater were analysed to 
determine the total concentration of the selected veterinary pharmaceuticals.  The pH, 
mobile phase, sample volume and solid phase sorbent were optimized to obtain the best 
resolution of these analytes. The extraction of pharmaceutical residues from water 
involves solid phase extraction while the extraction from suspended solid was achieved 
by ultrasonication -assisted hydrolysis by ethyl acetate followed by tandem solid phase 
extraction in order to obtain the clean form of the analytes.  
The recovery of each pha rmaceutical was between 72% and 95%, with relative 
standard deviation ranging from 5% to 9.5% in the aqueous phase. In the suspended 
solids, the recovery ranged between 70% and 92% with relative standard deviation of 
2.5% to 12%. The method limit of quanti fication was 2.50, 4.83, 4.41, 2.60 and 1.50 µg/L 
for enrofloxacin, oxytetracycline, salicylic acid, 17β - estradiol, and 
sulfamethoxazole,  respectively in swine wastewater. log Kd values were 3.21, 2.40, 
1.81, 2.31 and 1.20 for enrofloxacin, oxytetracyclin e, salicylic acid, 17β - estradiol and 
sulfamethoxazole respectively in swine wastewater. Enrofloxacin and oxytetracycline 
showed significant affinities for the suspended solids, showing that the role played by 
these solid matrices in the sorption of veteri nary pharmaceuticals cannot be ignored.

Urea fertilization and herbicide applications are management practices used in the 
grassland production. Urea produce significant pH changes, increasing soil pH initially 
and subsequent acidification of soils. These changes could modify strongly the behavior 
of some herbicides in soils1. On the other hand , the effect of herbicides on specific 
functional groups of microorganisms, such as nitrifying -bacteria in volcanic soils is even 
little understood and it needs to be studied to optimize the use of nitrogen and reduce 
environmental pollution associated wit h fertilizer and herbicides2. The main aim of the 
study was to evaluate the effect of MCPA herbicide on urea mineralization and urease 
activity in the rhizosphere of Lolium perenne  in an Andisol fertilized with urea.  
The experiment was conducted under gree nhouse conditions with a  randomized 
experimental design with five pot replicates for treatment. Urea was applied in equivalent 
rate of 0 -200 kgNha-1. MCPA was applied in two rates, equivalent to field recommended 
rate and twice (1 Lha-1, 2 Lha-1), after on e day of urea application. Soil samples were 
taken periodically during 50 days, in a destructive sampling. In each soil sample urease 
activity, nitrate and ammonia concentration (N -NO 3- and N -NH 4+) were evaluated. 
Besides, pH was record in each soil sample .  
The urea hydrolysis produced a significant pH change in the rhizosphere of Lolium 
perenne  increasing from 5.9 to 7.4 at day 3, followed by a significant decreasing to 5.5 
after 20 days. The urease activity decreased significantly in soils with MCPA appl ication 
ranging from 50 to 20% at 1 -3 days, compared with urea treated soils. After this time , no 
significant differences were found. During 10 -20 day, where the nitrification process 
occurs in this soil, the N -NO 3- concentration decreased significantly in  soils with MCPA 
application ranging from 30 to 20%, compared with urea treated soils. After this time no 
significant differences were found. For N -NH 4+ concentration no differences were found. 
Changes in ammonia -oxidizing bacteria (AOB) communities are be ing conducted for 
these conditions. These results suggest MCPA application could adversely affect the 
urea mineralization process and plant nutrition .

knowledge of the environmental impacts produced by each waste can cause changes

Debido a que las infecciones fágicas continúan siendo un problema significativo en la 
industria láctea fermentativa pese a las diversas  estrategias implementadas para su 
control, resulta necesario el desarrollo de nuevas tecnologías que, sumadas a las ya 
existentes, permitan llevar a cabo los procesos fermentativos de manera satisfactoria. 
El objetivo del presente trabajo fue diseñar y co nstruir un reactor fotocatalítico 
(UV/TiO 2) para estudiar la inactivación de fagos presentes en bioaerosoles, 
entendiendo a éstos como la principal vía de dispersión de los viriones por los 
ambientes industriales.  
El equipo diseñado es un sistema cerrado con recirculación que consta de una 
cámara de acero inoxidable (forma cúbica, de 0,6m de lado ) donde circula el aire 
conteniendo las partículas fágicas, y un compartimento de acrílico (reactor) donde 
se alojan 6 placas de borosilicato conteniendo el catali zador. El reactor es 
iluminado exteriormente por 14 lámparas UV. Ambos están conectados a través 
de un ventilador que facilita la circulación de la muestra. La muestra conteniendo 
las partículas fágicas es inyectada utilizando un nebulizador a pistón. La t oma de 
muestra es realizada sobre las 6 placas (ambas caras) que contienen el 
catalizador mediante un sistema de esponja/bolsa (Whirl -Pak) y medio de cultivo 
adecuado para su procesamiento y posterior titulación de las partículas fágicas.  
La puesta a punto  del reactor se llevó a cabo utilizando el fago B1 (cepa 
hospedadora Lb. plantarum  ATCC 8014), la muestra se nebulizó durante 35 
minutos con el ventilador encendido  para facilitar la circulación de la misma. El 
ventilador permaneció encendido durante 85 mi nutos adicionales luego de 
terminada la nebulización, lo cual constituye dos horas de ensayo en total. Luego 
de este período de tiempo se realizó la correspondiente toma de muestra.  Las 
pruebas se realizaron para: i) placas de borosilicato sin catalizador y lámparas UV 
apagadas (control 1), ii) placas de borosilicato con catalizador y lámparas UV 
apagadas (control 2) y iii) placas de borosilicato con catalizador y lámparas UV 
encendidas. Los recuentos fágicos obtenidos luego de dos horas de ensayo 
fueron de  2,0x104 UFP/cm2 (4,1 órdenes log) (prueba i), 3,0x103 UFP/cm2 (3,3 órdenes 
log) (prueba ii) y 1,0x102 UFP/cm2 (1,9 órdenes log) (prueba iii). Estos estudios 
demostraron que el reactor funciona de manera adecuada y que la fotocatálisis 
(UV/TiO 2) resultó ef ectiva en la inactivación del fago B1 ya que se observó una caída 
neta de 2,2 órdenes log en los recuentos. Esta disminución está asociada al fenómeno 
de adsorción de las partículas fágicas sobre las placas de borosilicato (caída de 0,8 
orden log en los re cuentos) y al efecto propio de la fotocatálisis (disminución de 1,4 
órdenes log).

Una tecnología de gran desarrollo en la actualidad es la generación de polímeros de 
origen bacteriano para producir plástico biod egradable. La mayor apuesta consiste en la 
recuperación del carbono de las aguas residuales, transformándolo en ácidos de 
cadena corta para la generación de polihidroxialcanoatos (PHA). Dicho proceso se 
consigue mediante el uso de bacterias provenientes de  lodo activado sometidas a 
régimen de alimentación discontinua en reactores aerobios, estimulando el almacenaje 
intracelular del carbono en forma de PHA.  
Dado que el origen de los organismos productores de PHA es un cultivo microbiano 
mixto, las condicione s de operación que se impongan a un reactor afectarán la 
selección de microorganismos acumuladores de PHA y por consiguiente la producción 
del polímero. En un reactor de este tipo, las bacterias seleccionadas tendrán afinidad 
con el oxígeno como aceptor de  electrones. Sin embargo, dependiendo de las etapas 
secuenciales de cada ciclo de operación, se puede llegar a seleccionar desde bacterias 
aerobias obligadas hasta facultativas. Al inducir ciclos de sedimentación en reactores 
secuenciales de selección (SBR ) (usados para compactación del lodo en dichos 
reactores), se puede llegar a la anaerobiosis tras suprimir la aireación y/o agitación 
debido al consumo del oxígeno disuelto (OD).  
En este trabajo se comparó las poblaciones microbianas seleccionadas en dos 
reactores SBR operados bajo las mismas condiciones tras dos meses de operación,  
con excepción de que uno se operó con una etapa de sedimentación (RCS) y otro sin 
sedimentación (RSS). El inoculo para la selección fue lodo activado de la planta de 
tratamient o de aguas servidas de la ciudad de Temuco, Chile. Los resultados indicaron 
que en ambos reactores se observó producción de PHA (hasta 30 % del peso seco). 
Sin embargo, en el reactor RCS se seleccionaron organismos de naturaleza 
filamentosa, mientras que e n el reactor RSS se seleccionaron bacterias formadoras de 
flóculos y con alta capacidad de compactación en base a índice volumétrico de lodo 
(IVL< 100 mL/g). En el reactor RCS, a diferencia del RSS, la capacidad de 
compactación fue baja (IVL cercano a 250 mL/g). Tras observar los patrones de OD, se 
observó que en el RCS, tras 15 minutos de la etapa de sedimentación el reactor 
quedaba sin oxígeno, provocando anaerobiosis. Se estima que dicho fenómeno 
provocó el decaimiento de organismos aerobios obligados, p ermitiendo a organismos 
filamentosos mantener la supremacía.  
Tras este trabajo se desprende que el uso de una etapa de sedimentación debe estar 
restringida a un margen de tiempo limitado, evitando la limitación de oxígeno de manera 
que no se seleccionen or ganismos de naturaleza filamentosa.

issues to be considered were identified: the water quality against the rapid corrosion of 
pumping facilities in the capital city of La Rioja, and the dis posal of waste from the 
inverse osmosis plants that are used to treat underground brackish water in some of the 
province departments.  Regarding the first issue, an already concluded study detected 
that the premature deterioration of the pumping facilities is due to the MIC phenomenon 
(Microbiologically Induced Corrosion). Some signs of the MIC phenomenon in a well 
during its operation are the decrease of flow without a decrease in the phreatic level, 
and the alteration of the organoleptic quality of the wat er. Another sign appears during 
maintenance, in which the obstruction and embedding of filters and pressure pipes can 
be observed.  These aforementioned signs are present in La Rioja.  
In order to confirm the MIC phenomenon and propose the necessary correct ive 
measures, microbiological and optical microscopy tests were performed. 
Complementarily, scanning electron microscopy tests were performed as well.  The 
microbiological cultures grown in liquid and solid media showed the presence of aerobic 
ferrobacteria  (iron bacteria) and anaerobic sulfate -reducing bacteria, which is consistent 
with the MIC phenomenon.  During this phenomenon, bacteria accelerate the metal 
corrosion of the facilities. The rusted and dissolved metal precipitates as bacterial 
metabolites i n the form of biominerals. These biominerals have the same chemical 
composition as the iron minerals, but a peculiar structure is peculiar. The scanning 
electron microscopy performed on the embedded samples detected the organic 
morphology of the mineral, a nd the energy dispersive spectrometer detected the 
spectrum of the iron oxides.

required, since it is possible that the bacteria are nonnative and reach the aquifers by 
contami nation. These bacteria produce endospores when their environment is adversely 
altered, and reactivate when the conditions become adequate once again. The spores 
can contaminate the drilling equipment, which in turn, can inoculate them in another 
aquifer.  In regard to the second issue, it is still under study. A priori, two alternatives are

of facilities with low capacity, and the disposal in deep perforations or very sa lty waters

One of the most important current challenges is to find a solution to the pollution 
caused by waste and wastewater of  industrial and agricultural activities and to satisfy the 
growing demand of energy. Anaerobic digestion (AD) tends to solve the problem of 
wastewater with high content of organic matter through the availability of renewable 
energy source based on the use of the generated methane. Between livestock waste, 
swine wastewater is considered one of the most appropriate substrate to generate 
methane under AD due to its high both, water content and buffering capacity besides a 
wide variety of nutrients that anaerob ic bacteria requires. However, the estimation of net 
energy to be produced through this process is a complex task due to the wide range of 
factors that affect methane production. One of the parameters that mostly affect the AD 
process is the use inoculums since its type and nature influence on the methane 
kinetics. The application of inoculums (I) is often expressed in terms of the proportion of 
volatile solids (VS) added in relation to those provide by the substrate (S), therefore the 
parameter that repres ents the S/I ratio (SIR) is key to the efficiency of the process since 
it influences not only on methane productivity but the digester capacity.

as inoculums in three SIR (A: 1/1 , B: 3/1, C: 6/1), with t he objective to identify the ratio

capacity under mesophilic conditions were used to carry out the experience.

decreased from (382 ± 22) to (232 ± 5 ml/g SV) when SIR increased from 1:1 to 6:1.

Bioelectrochemical systems (BES) allow to obtain energy from microbial metabolism. 
These systems are based on the abilit y of certain microorganisms, such as bacteria of 
the genus Geobacter, to form biofilms on solid surfaces, which are used as final electron 
acceptors of cellular respiration. Thus, these microorganisms called electrogenic, oxidize 
organic compounds and tran sfer electrons to an external acceptor which can be used as 
anode in an electrochemical cell. Currently, BES  represent a promising approach to 
capture the chemical energy present in various effluents and its transformation into 
storable energy, such as H 2 or CH 4. In consequence, the actual costs of effluent 
treatments can be reduced. Additionally, there has emerged a new generation of BES 
aimed at various functions such as desalination, electrosynthesis and remediation of 
contaminated sediments. However, t he development of this technology has been 
hampered mainly by the low rate of charge transfer to the electrodes. For this reason, 
various materials that are able to overcome this limitation are under study. Among these 
materials, graphene has aroused great  interest in the area.  
The aim of this work was to develop electrodes that allow the development of biofilms 
of electrogenic bacteria to be used in BES. Therefore, we prepared electrodes 
employing bidirectional carbon fabric coated with graphene. Graphene was synthesized 
from the reduction of graphite oxide with ascorbic acid. We performed cytotoxicity 
assays with this material over Geobacter sulfurreducens  and E. coli  JM 109 pure 
cultures. This material did not alter cell viability in any case. Thus, we pr oceeded to use 
the electrode as an anode in microbial electrolysis cells. For this purpose, three 
electrode systems were assembled using platinum wire as counter electrode and an 
Ag/AgCl reference electrode. We performed a first characterization of the ele ctrodes by 
cyclic voltammetry and then the working electrode was polarized at 0.24 V. The 
electrolysis cells were inoculated 24 hours later with a pure culture of G. sulfurreducens .

current was reached. The results showed that the rate of adhesion of bacteria to 
graphene -based electrode was similar to that of a standard graphite electrode. However, 
the current reached with graphene electrode during the growth phase of the bio film was 
five times higher than that of the graphite electrode. The biofilms were observed by 
scanning electron microscopy. In conclusion, the proposed material proved to be highly 
efficient in the electrochemical system tested.

Paved surfaces modify the urban water cycles because their imperviousness alter the 
natural drainage pathways and diminish aquifer recharge. Consequently, urban runoff 
increases, as well as the occurrence of peak flows and floodings. Bioretention cells are 
low-impact developments that are being gradually implemented around the world to 
mitigate the negative consequences of urban runoff and to improve its quality. These 
systems are ground depressions filled with filtering material and covered with vegetation, 
which retain urban runoff and allow its physical, chemical and biological treatment. 
Bioretention cells are not widely employed in xeric climates yet, even though flo odings 
and peak flows are also common in cities located in these regions. To this end, the aim 
of this work was to design a bioretention cell to be constructed in our university campus 
based on the knowledge of the local hydrological cycle.   
We employed t he rainfall, temperature, and evapotranspiration data provided by the 
Mexican meteorological agency for the 1980 -2013 period. The direction of the runoff 
was analyzed from a topographical survey, and it was found that a micro watershed of 
113,565.4 m2 with 48% of perviousness is the critical zone for the runoff control in the 
campus. From the average rainfall data, we calculated both the water volume that can 
be harvested in the watershed and the peak discharge flow. Also, from a design rainfall 
(mm/h), the  design rainfall intensity and the design flow were calculated. Following these 
estimations, a bioretention cell was sized, which will allow to harvest around 182 m3 of 
urban runoff per month and to reuse it for aquifer recharge. In this way, the runoff 
volume could be reduced by 51%.  
It is our view that the construction of low -impact technologies like bioretention cells 
could mitigate the impact of impervious surfaces and optimize water management in 
urban areas of xeric regions.

cm were used as support to immobilize the paints. The ‘‘dip -coating’’ technique was

suspe nsion were spread over the coated plates. The dry plates were exposed to visible 
or UV radiation for different time periods. After the programmed irradiation time for each 
sample, the photocatalytic plates were removed and the remaining viable conidia were

inactivation of a commercial antifungal paint with the  disadvantage of employing

Emerging micropollutants (EM), including pharmaceuticals and  personal 
care products  (PPCP), whose adverse effects can be felt at very low concentrations and 
often disrupt endocrine functions in higher organisms, often escape conventional 
wastewate r treatment, such as activated sludge and physicochemical nonspecific 
approaches such as ozonation. An attractive and ‘greener’ alternative is the use of 
biocatalysis for the removal and detoxification of EM.  In some cases, PPCP removal 
can be enhanced in  microbial systems involving biofilms and/or active nitrification. In the 
latter, EM are (co)metabolized thanks to ammonia monooxygenase. This and other 
oxidative enzymes like cytochrome P -450 are involved in the transformation and 
removal of EM and their biological effects.  Similarly, fungal laccases and peroxidases 
are suited to the degradation of EM. The re -usability of such enzymes and their 
separability from reactants and products can be ensured by carrier -based immobilization 
or by formation of cross -linked enzyme aggregates (CLEA).  
We have identified key factors for the production of CLEA of laccases alone or of 
combined oxidoreductases1, and we have improved these novel biocatalysts by applying 
rational experimental design and optimization methodolo gies. Multi -enzyme biocatalysts 
co-aggregated in combi -CLEA showed activity over a broad pH range implying their 
suitability for the treatment of EM -contaminated real wastewaters of varying pH. Finally

encapsulated by biomimetic methodologies2. These laccase -biotitania biocatalyst 
particles were able to catalyze the removal of bisphenol A, 17 -ethinylestradiol and 
diclofenac in a mixture of six model PPCP and retained 90% of activity  after five reaction 
cycles and 60% after 10 cycles.

sustainable treatment of EM -contaminated matrices and multiplies our options for 
environmentally relevant industrial proces ses.

tecnologías más novedosas se encuentra el biosecado, que comparte algunas ventajas

tiempo de proceso. El material seco por el proceso de biosecado es susceptible de ser 
aprovechado energéticamente utilizándolo como combustible renovable; sin embargo, 
su potencial de valorización es muy amplio y se ha propuesto su uso como abono 
orgánico en suelos,  con fines de fertilización y reciclaje de los nutrientes y la materia 
orgánica. El objetivo de este estudio fue evaluar la fitotoxicidad de material biosecado, 
mediante un bioensayo estandarizado de toxicidad en la germinación de semillas de

conjunto, los resul tados muestran que el material biosecado no tuvo un efecto tóxico

materia orgánica fresca resultando aún menos tóxico que la misma composta, la cual 
presentó una CI 50 menor que el material biosecado. Particularmente el extracto de la 
cáscara de naranja fresca, inhibió la germinación de las semillas a partir de 0.05 g/ml, 
así como el crecimiento de la plántula. Los materiales probados en este estudio pueden 
ordenarse en orden crec iente de DL 50 como sigue: cáscara de naranja, pasto, mulch, 
composta y material biosecado. Lo anterior se explica por la mineralización de los 
materiales por los procesos de compostaje y biosecado, lo cual favorece la eliminación 
de ácidos orgánicos que pu dieran ser fitotóxicos. En conclusión, el material biosecado 
no es fitotóxico en concentraciones menores a 0.5 g/ml, sino que parece favorecer la 
absorción correcta de nutrientes y el crecimiento de las plántulas, por lo que pudiera ser

las heladas son más habituales e intensas debido al cambio climático. Este panorama 
afecta al desarrollo de plantaciones de Eucalyptus grandis, especie  más sensible a  las 
bajas temperaturas. El programa de mejoramiento forestal de INTA, propone como 
alternativa a E. dunnii, especie de mayor tolerancia a bajas temperaturas, que a pesar de 
presentar menor aptitud para usos como madera sólida de alto valor  debido a un alt o nivel 
de tensiones de crecimiento y menor estabilidad dimensional, es posible su mejoramiento 
genético.  
La genotipificación por secuenciación (GBS, Genotyping by sequencing ) es un método 
de exploración genómica que permite identificar una gran cantidad S NPs ( Single Nucleotide 
Polymorphism ), y realizar diferentes estudios a nivel poblacional con un costo menor que 
empleando microarreglos,  para su posterior aplicación al mejoramiento molecular . 
El presente trabajo tuvo como objetivo la puesta a punto de la metodología de GBS en E. 
dunnii . Para ello, se secuenciaron por Next Generation Sequencing  genotecas de 7 
genotipos diferentes de E. dunnii siguiendo 2 protocolos de doble restricción enzimática con 
modificaciones . Las secuencias fueron analizadas por cali dad y mapeadas contra el 
genoma de referencia de E. grandis v2.0  con el programa Bowtie2 . Para la búsqueda de 
SNPs se empleó el Software Stacks v1.35 .

las cuales mapearon e n promedio el 84% contra el genoma de referencia, detectando 
alrededor de 10.000 haplotipos polimórficos distribuidos homogéneamente, con un 22% de 
datos perdidos.

para E. dunnii. Esta metodología de alta procesividad permitirá evaluar la población de 
mejoramiento fenotipada para características maderables de interés, empleando estrategias 
de Mapeo por asociación y Selección Genómica. En una próxima etapa, se aplicará a 
plantines de las progenies de esta población, asistiendo a la selección temprana de los 
árboles con menores tensiones de crecimiento y mejor estabilidad dimensional, 
potenciando su implantación en regiones no aptas para el cultivo de E grandis . Es 
importante  destacar la relevancia de contar con esta metodología dado que puede ser 
extrapolable a otras especies, particularmente arbóreas, de interés para el mejoramiento y 
la conservación.

Los ambientes acuáticos como ríos y embalses son utilizados con fines recreativos 
tanto de contacto primario como secundario. Sin embargo muchas veces estas 
actividades antropogénicas como así también las descargas ilegales de efluentes, son 
causa s del deterioro del recurso generando un riesgo para la población principalmente 
por la presencia de agentes químicos o de patógenos . A su vez, los microorganismos 
presentes en agua no siempre se encuentran libres sino que en algunos casos pueden 
adherirse  a partículas sólidas, sedimentando con ellas en el lecho del ambiente 
acuático, lo que les brinda una mayor persistencia. En la provincia de Salta (noroeste de 
Argentina), el Río Wierna es muy utilizado principalmente durante la estación húmeda, 
con fines  recreativos. Sin embargo, durante esta estación, las intensas lluvias 
ocasionan el aumento del caudal y de la turbidez (partículas arcillosas) de los ríos y la 
consecuente resuspensión de los sedimentos con los microorganismos adheridos a 
éstos, A pesar d e que se han realizado investigaciones en donde se comprobó una 
mayor carga microbiana en el agua durante la estación húmeda, no se analizaron los 
microorganismos en los sedimentos. El objetivo de este trabajo fue evaluar la variación 
de la calidad microbi ológica en agua y sedimentos del río Wierna durante tres 
momentos diferentes dentro de la estación húmeda. Para ello, se realizaron tres 
muestreos: el primero antes de que ocurriera la primera lluvia fuerte (pre -lluvia), el 
segundo el día posterior a una l luvia fuerte que hubiera superado los 50 mm (lluvia) y el 
tercero un tiempo después de la primera lluvia (post -lluvia). En cada muestreo se 
tomaron tres réplicas (de agua y sedimentos) de la zona seleccionada. Las muestras se 
colectaron en recipientes esté riles y se conservaron a 4 °C hasta su procesamiento en 
el laboratorio. El recuento de coliformes totales y fecales se realizó por el método de 
tubos múltiples; y aerobios mesófilos totales, Es cherichia coli , Pseudomonas 
aeruginosa , enterococos y Salmonell a spp. por el método de filtración por membrana. 
Los resultados evidenciaron que tanto en la pre -lluvia como en la post -lluvia, el mayor 
porcentaje de  microorganismos se encontró en los sedimentos (80 -90%). Para el caso 
del período lluvia la cantidad de m icroorganismos en aguas y en sedimentos fue similar 
(40-50% en agua y 50 -60% en sedimentos). Con respecto al agua, la carga microbiana 
a lo largo de los muestreos fue máxima durante la temporada de lluvia y mínima en la

 Parasitic c ontami nation of public places in urban and rural 
environments  in the Slovak Republic  
 
I. Papajova(1), N. Sasakova *(2), J. Pipikova(1), F. Tóth(1), J. Venglovsky(2) 
 (1) Institute of Parasitology of the Slovak Academy of Sciences, Hlinkova 3, 040 01 Košice, Slov ak

(2) University of Veterinary Medicine and Pharmacy in Kosice, Komenského 73, 041 81 Košice, Slovak 
Republic;  
 
The increasing densities of dog populations in urban and rural aglomeration and the 
close relationship of people with their animals pr ovide the benefits to human beings. 
Besides these benefits , large populations of untreated owned animals or stray dogs and 
cats present a continuous reservoir of infection, contamination of the environment with 
parasitic germs and potential sources of infe ction to humans and other paratenic hosts. 
Dogs are associated with more than 60 zoonotic parasites. These animals pose a 
serious zoonotic risk as they have the potential of to transmit zoonotic parasites through 
contamination of the environment with paras ite eggs and oocysts in excrements. Since 
the public places have free access to pet and stray animals, they potentially act as a 
source of contamination. Pets are brought to such public places for defeacation, thereby 
contaminating the soil. In Slovak Repu blic, u p to 70 % of dogs faeces are found in lawns 
with the dwelling houses nearby.  
The present study was carried out to ascertain the presence of parasitic germs in 
dog’s  faeces collected at random from the public health importance places in urban and 
rural localities in the Slovak Republic.  
Out of 578 dog’s excrements from public places, 26.8% of them were found positive for 
the presence of the propagative stages of endoparasites. 8 species of intestinal 
endoparasites were detected in samples, dominated  by T. canis  eggs. Particularly, dogs 
from the big towns showed lower prevalence than dogs from smaller towns and villages.  
High prevalence of Toxocara spp. eggs and eggs of other intestinal helminths in dogs 
pointed to the contamination of the environment , in which animals move. Therefore 
contamination of sand samples from the sandpits were also monitored. Out of 285 
sandpits, parasite eggs were detected in 9.5 % of them. The unfenced sandpits were 
found to be more contaminated than fenced sandpits.  
The re sults of the present study show that public places in studied urban and rural 
localities in the Slovak Republic pose the main area for risk of human exposure eggs. 
Soil contamination is prevalent in peridomestic environments and is exacerbated by 
poverty, poor hygiene and the risk of contact with infected animals.  
In conclusion, intestinal parasites do represent a silent hazard not only for other 
animals, but also for the general public health.
